description:
Dirt cheap for some organic vegan ice cream in a prime location!! 

I can't say it was the best, most mind blowing ice cream I've ever had, but heck for less than $2, sign me tf up.
author: Aria S.

description:
Best ice cream in SF. Rich flavors, reasonable prices, and consistently good service. I've been coming here for years and am always surprised at how many people have never tried it; truly a hidden gem in the Mission. They use Strauss dairy (a local farm that's known for exceptional quality) as a base for their flavors. Get the saffron or the brown sugar banana with chocolate chips.

Bonus: All of their utensils and bowls are compostable and Xanath has (not-so-fun) facts about the impact of plastics and man-made materials on the earth and what they are doing to contribute to a solution. They're the only completely solar powered ice cream shop in the country!
author: tura s.

description:
Been here a couple times, inexpensive decent quality ice cream.

Ice cream here is relatively cheap compared to surrounding ice cream parlors snd it's organic!
I had their banana ice cream and it was pretty good, and I've gotten their green tea and i wasn't as big of a fan. The green tea tasted like the green tea latte powder from trader joes made into ice cream.

Their cones are interesting theyre super long have the look of a pale sugar cone with the consistency of a thin cake cone.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Super yummy & not so pricey like other spots. I'm so into vanillas & this place hits the spot. I just wish they had more flavors. Super yummy & worth a visit.
author: R C.

description:
3.5/5
Stopped by for some ice cream as we were walking to more ice cream. Been wanting to try this place for forever. Place was fairly empty on a Friday night though people slowly trickled in and out. There are 2 bench seating areas, otherwise not much room.

Service was friendly and helpful. Overall the ice cream was on the sweet side but still distinct and flavorful. Very creamy and almost a bit too soft but they did hold up alright. I got the spicy ginger saffron and the employee recommended I pair it w/ cookies and cream. This was a surprisingly good pairing. The cookies and cream weren't too sweet so it mellowed out the overly sweet and nicely spiced ginger saffron. The cone texture was also great. They look very unique and have a lovely wafer like crunch. Taste-wise they were a bit strange. Almost cardboard-like but my friend and I both agreed that with some time you get used it and it becomes rather addictive.

Price here was also very reasonable compared to a lot of other spots in the city. There portions are also very generous. I don't know if it's good enough to make a stop back but it's decent ice cream for a good price point.
author: Vivian C.

description:
3.5 stars.
Cheap Mexican Icecream place w/ a variety of flavors (takes credit card)!

- Ordered Matcha green tea, Tasted like a green tea frap/ latte (includes a creamy milk taste). Was great but melted fast. 

- Sampled:  Saffron Ginger ( bright yellow, strong flavor of spice & sweetness ), Fig ( unique buttery & fruity taste, also sweet), Mango (authentic & refreshing), and Roasted Almond (rich & creamy)

- Variety of flavors include Mecian Cajeta, pina Colada, Saffron, (menu in photo) etc. 

- Friendly staff who lets you try as many flavors as possible. Kids scoop, single scoop, double scoop in a cup are all under $5. Cost-wise it's a great deal!

- Came in first-time on Memorial Day (super hot day). Waited for about 15 minutes to order, bc line was long. Only one staff serving when I went. Can be a bit more staffed & time-efficient. 

- Overall ambiance is very casual, with minimal decors, and few seatings. People usually grab-n-go.
author: Jess W.

description:
The ice cream here isn't particularly good, the quality is somewhat mediocre, the selling point though is that the ice cream is super cheap!

You can get a single scoop on a "waffle" cone for about $2-3! I enjoyed the banana cream flavor I had and at that price point it was quite the bargain.

They also have some specials with the frozen yogurt for like $1.50 if you pay with cash! Great value!
author: Tyler T.

description: Best ice cream spot in the world!! But where's the Saffron Ice Cream?!  Bring it back!  Mexican Cajeta, Red Walnut and the Saffron Ginger are super yummy but the Saffron is the bestest ever!! It would be nice to see the Wanted Posters removed from the windows
author: Ruth M.

description: Delicious ice cream at a great price! A single large scoop is only $2.99, and comes with your choice of cake or sugar cone. There's a wide variety of flavors and simple froyo too. Two benches for searing so definitely more of a grab and go place, but when we went there were no lines.  Definitely worth it to come fulfill your ice cream cravings in the Mission!
author: Hali M.

description: Was passing by with my child dressed in Halloween costume. An elderly gentleman was resting outside. When he saw my toddler, he immediately got up, invited my son in and gave him a free ice-cream. Such a sweet gesture. I am sure this sweetness translates into the ice-cream they make as well. It was best part of Halloween for me.
author: Ambica M.

description: A hidden gem! I really enjoyed their brown sugar banana chocolate ice cream and Mexican cajeta. It's a surprisingly good pairing! The first flavor has a similar taste to a banana bread and the second flavor is a dulce de leche. Survive was great and there's plenty of space to sit.
author: Instafamishe D.

description:
Possibly one of the most affordable ice cream places in SF! They have special deals if you pay in cash for specific items like frozen yogurt on a cake cone for $1.50 and $.99 for kids. I tried the mint chocolate chip and Mexican vanilla bean, both of which were delicious! They had a ton of flavor options and you can try as many as you want before ordering. They also sell vanilla beans in their store if you're in need of any for a cooking project.

Only thing I didn't really like was their sugar cone - it was kind of stale and wasn't as good as it looked.
author: Jacqueline H.

description:
Simply The Best Ice Cream in the Inner Mission!  It's small and unassuming, but the ice cream flavors are superb and robust, while the consistency is excellent with that nice, creamy mouthfeel.  Xanath imports vanilla beans/extract as well as saffron, and as such you can get saffron-flavor ice cream, and two different types of vanilla ice cream.  I personally love their espresso flavor, and the dulce de leche is DIVINE!!

Unlike Bi-Rite, there aren't ever long lines for this creamery, the ice cream is smooth and creamy (not ice-crystal-y), and the prices are VERY affordable.  The only better ice cream on this side of the city is Mitchell's, but that's a 7 minute drive from here (not to mention a long wait).  

There is limited seating inside and out:  2 benches with tables inside, and 1 adult-height bench and 1 child-height bench outside.  There is an awning, too, so you don't get a sunburn (or rained on!).

Xanath is WHEELCHAIR-ACCESSIBLE!!  Yay!

I've never understood why Xanath doesn't have longer lines, because the ice cream is DEFINITELY worth the wait, but I'm very glad they don't!  I HIGHLY recommend this joint to anyone and everyone!!!
author: Amy L.

description:
Delicious, affordable, and in a great spot! I personally like this place more than bi-rite (please don't send me hate mail).
The texture of the ice cream here is delicious- if you've ever had saffron and rose in LA, that's what the texture is like. It's more gummy and stretchy than regular ice cream places and I LOVE IT. The pricing is also way more reasonable than bi-rite. A scoop with two flavors is less than $4, which is outrageous for SF. 
I got the saffron and the brown sugar and they were both sooo delicious. The saffron smell wasn't that strong but the taste was amazing, and the brown sugar was just......heavenly.....
I also really like the cones here! They're long and skinny which make them easy to hold and eat~
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description:
There is nothing special about this ice cream place. It is a ice cream and froyo shop in the Mission. The prices seemed reasonable and the ice cream taste like ice cream. 

I sampled the Huckleberry, it was ok. Didn't love it and I like huckleberries. What I ended up ordering was the mint chocolate chip, kid sized scoop in a cup. 

The people behind the counter were nice and the service was prompt. I wouldn't travel out of my way to visit Xanath. If you were eating a meal in the area and wanted some dessert, this place could be a place for dessert.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
After dinner nearby, I was craving something sweet. A quick search on Yelp and this spot promised a range of dairy free seasonal sorbets! 

I made my whole team walk up a few hills just to get a taste of their selections. When I arrived, I asked what dairy free options they had and my excitement fell when I was told there was only one option: mango.

The mango was decent but not better than mango sorbet I've purchased at the grocery store. I can't say if the other ice cream is good but if you want something dairy-free, I'd recommend going elsewhere.
author: Brittany F.

description:
Stopped by here after dinner to seal the meal with something sweet. I got a child's size scoop of the roasted almond ice cream. 

As far as portion sizes go, I was satisfied with the child's size scoop, so if you only want a little bit of ice cream this is definitely the way to go. The roasted almond ice cream was good, but not so sweet. I decided to try it out because I hadn't seen that flavor in other ice cream shops. The place itself wasn't busy on a Saturday night and we were able to test a couple of flavors before committing. The price was ok: ~2 dollars for the child's size. Overall, standard ice cream shop with a decent variety of flavors; it's good if you want some ice cream without wanting to wait a long time, but didn't stand out as something special.
author: Lucine O.

description: I got the strawberry ice-cream, it was so creamy and delicious! They have a lot of other interesting flavors such as saffron ginger. The prices were very affordable and definitely worth it.
author: Laurel W.

description:
The ice cream I was given was very "Icey"
Like it had thawed out and re-froze... I had bad luck cause it looked like they had taken the last bit of an old container and slopped it all over the top of the new full container of ice cream.... anyways... it was disappointing because I wanted to enjoy the creamy vanilla Ice cream but just kept crunching on ice crystals.... let down.
author: Chris T.

description: I like that this place has stepped it up with their nondairy coconut-based soft serve since the last times I've been here! They don't have quite the expanded taste profile that they offer with the dairy ice creams, but they still taste pretty good, though very sweet and not the smoothest consistency if that's what you're hoping for though I enjoyed it. The prices can't be beat for a place that is all organic is a plus, but they could use some more toppings and gluten free cone options!
author: Samira I.

description: As I poured vanilla into my coffee this morning (I know, I know!), I thought about how much I love this little neighborhood business. It's nice to know there's a place where you can still even *get* a high-quality vanilla by walking into a business rather than being forced to order online. But Xanath is the vanilla expert! You can take your pick of all different bottle sizes and price points and choose between Mexican vanilla and the Madagascar (I think?) variety. And it's nice to know that there's still something unique in this city - that there's a business left in the Mission that actually has a little character. I *love* how make-shift their signs are - written with love - with great information about the environment and why eating ice cream from a place that cares about sustainability is the way to go! (Makes you feel good about having your treat! : ) And, just my personal preference but I also LOVE how the owner held out for many many months - maybe even a full year - with his gigantic, life-sized cardboard cutout of Bernie Sanders in the window - long after the election was over, let alone the primaries. I agree with the reviewer who talked about this place being the best kept secret in the Mission. It's ridiculous to see the long lines at much lesser ice cream establishments (at Smitten, where I went only once and that was more than enough, the 'ice cream' - if you can call it that! - wasn't even COLD!). The locals in the neighborhood know they can trust Xanath for delicious, high-quality ice cream at a reasonable price. (I think a lot of people would be surprised to learn that Xanath is using the same high-quality ingredients as a more expensive place but they just decided to keep their prices reasonable, which is wonderful for the long-time neighbors who aren't millionaires....) I'm also incredibly grateful to them for their sweetness to my little doggie girl who LOVED the taste of vanilla ice cream they so kindly gave her a spoonful of as a special treat when we visited. Great neighborhood business very worthy of your support!
author: Heidi-Jane S.

description:
Delish! Dropped by here on a walk back to the 24th st Bart - and glad we did! My friend and I shared a single scoop of the huckleberry. I've never had huckleberry before - the flavor was intriguing, but what stood out to me most was the creaminess of the ice cream.

Service was great. I'll be back to try the ginger saffron next time!
author: Larissa M.

description:
You had at me at organic, just kidding, you had me at ice cream shop in the Mission with zero wait time and zero lines. I was in dire need of ice cream and was too bratty to wait in that seemingly endless Bi-Rite line. 

Ice Cream: Nice selection of unique flavors, but nowadays that's just the SF standard. Fresh selection of organic ice cream, gelato and soft-serve froyo. I sampled the Saffron Ginger which tasted mostly like vanilla mixed with caramelized ginger; no saffron flavor at all. I also tried their Fig flavor and was pleased; even more so when the employee mentioned it was NSA and the sweetness was completely from the figs used. Dreamy and creamy; the texture was soft and packed with fresh fig flavor. I do wish they would have added some chopped up figs or nuts to contrast the texture and enhance the flavor a bit more. Overall, it was really tasty and fresh.

Ambiance: Small, simple, clean and very limited seating.

Price: I paid $2.00 for a child's scoop in a sugar cone - scoop was generous; but the cone was  oddly shaped and not packed with ice cream. They have a senior citizen rate which I think is wonderful. 

Service: Employees weren't very outgoing, but they were courteous and patient with us. 

Overall: Great selection of unique flavors, good service, ice cream is fresh and taste is a little above average; but nothing to write home about.
author: Astrid Z.

description: Plentiful ice cream choices that looked delicious! Dairy free, non-gmo yogurt selections! I got vanilla and pumpkin flavor froyo while my friend got green tea froyo. Both were super delicious! Cute little seating area inside. CASH ONLY! Great prices. and if you are looking to charge your phone, there's no outlets. Enjoy the treat with temperature-changing-color spoons!
author: Dimitri R.

description:
I'm a newly-diagnosed lactose intolerant human.

It's a rough world.

I wanted to love this spot. Self-preservation. Got a scoop of the dulce de leche.

It tastes a little overwhelmingly sweet, followed up by a grainy sorta taste. Craving not fulfilled. Couldn't finish it, didn't wanna waste my calories on this:/
author: Gabriela W.

description:
I love this down home place . If you wonder why old school folks complain about current places and flavors and prices ... Come here !
No bells and whistles , just cheap tasty ice cream .  Saffron ginger , once i tried that it is all I get ! Unusual flavors , good service .  What a concept !
author: Susan P.

description: This was a great little socially-aware ice cream place.  It's very good, organic, sustainable and somehow inexpensive, too.   I loved both the saffron and the ginger ice cream.
author: Beverly H.

description:
Came in for dessert post dinner with a friend. I ordered myself a double scoop of matcha and blueberry. I also took a taste test of the fig. The fig ice cream certainly lived up to its namesake imparting a strong fig flavor. However, I found it to be a bit too sweet so I didn't order it.

Scoop-wise, they definitely do not skimp! For 4.75, the amount of ice cream I received was certainly a steal! However, flavor-wise, it didn't quite meet the mark. Starting with my matcha flavor, it did not compare to Polly Ann's. While it did taste like a matcha green tea frap from Starbucks, the texture was gritty. I like my ice cream smooth and creamy, so this textural surprise wasn't exactly a pleasurable experience. Likewise with my blueberry scoop, I found it to be inundated with ice crystals. However, as a flavor, I thought it was pretty good. It actually reminded me of the blueberry cheesecake flavor from Fenton's, just a bit. Tried a spoon of my friend's mint too - more pepperminty than spearmint.
author: Elaine Y.

description: There are no lines! Of 20 ice cream shops in the mission, Xanath almost never requires an arduous process of waiting in line. The ice cream isn't anything to rave about but it's decent. The soft serve is vegan (made with coconut milk). It's only $1.50! Pretty good too. But not as delicious as bi-rite's soft swerve!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
There's always room for ice cream! My friends and I stopped by here since bi-rite's line was around the corner at night.

Price wasn't too bad for $2.99 a single scoop. I got the apricot and madagascar vanilla. The apricot was okay, a little on the sour side but the Madagascar vanilla was really good and smooth. They have a decent amount of cool flavors too such as blueberry, fig, vanilla Tahitian coconut, Mexican vanilla, etc. which I thought was fun to select from.

Would definitely be back to Xanath if I want a cheaper alternative or if I don't want to wait in a crazy long line.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Super great ice cream right on Valencia. Went here after the Bi-Rite line was 4x normal and wasn't disappointed.

Delicious Dutch chocolate and yummy green tea ice cream all presented in a really tall sugar cone with great service. Nice folks and a positive and friendly attitude. 

Nice that there's basically no line, but parking is, well, parking in the mission.
author: Bob K.

description: Love the place. They have really great flavors, very unique and good. Fig and huckleberrry are really tasty, though I didn't like ginger saffron. Highly recommended.
author: Vannie N.

description: Imagine: you're in the mission. You've just had a late dinner with friends and you're craving ice cream. But wait! By 9:15 on a Sunday all the staples are closed! That's when you turn to Yelp and find this gem. If it wasn't surrounded by so many other great ice cream joints, I'm sure it would be the #1 stop in the hood. They let you try as many flavors you like & let you opt for the kid's scoop even if you're not a kid. Loved all the funky flavors they had (I went with Saffron-so good!). But if you can't make up your mind and want to split, you have to order at least a small.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Was on a biking adventure zipping up Valencia street when I see an extremely catchy sign: '$1.99 Organic Frozen Yogurt.' Wowzers; how could anything worth having in the Mission be sold for that little?!

The next time I was wandering around in the area following a wonderful meal at a nearby Vietnamese restaurant, I mentioned what I had seen the other day. She was equally stoked regarding the affordability (note: starting at $1.50 for a child-size scoop in a cone if you pay in cash) & local feel of the place and so we gave it a shot. After trying a decent amount of flavors (brown sugar banana banana, roasted almond, matcha), she decided that brown sugar banana chip was superior, whereas I fell for the caramel toffee. We both went for a two-flavor split single cup - she went for a small scoop of brown sugar banana chip atop a scoop of Tahitian coconut vanilla , while I went for a small scoop of caramel toffee atop a scoop of brown sugar banana chip (3 bucks). We enjoyed the ice cream and banter on the super-cool wooden bench/table combo that faces the main window. The scene was peaceful, and reminded me of The Yogurt Pump (YoPo) in Chapel Hill, which is held dearly close to my heart.

This place is amazing. I would hardly consider going anywhere else - with exception of Bi-Rite - in the area, because the quality of the ice cream is so good here and at such an affordable price point. This very well may be my favorite ice cream shop in The Mission, San Francisco, even Bay Area!
author: Anish T.

description:
Two scoops of ice cream for $1.99 on a waffle cone. Count me in!

The ice cream is decent for that price, I don't think how anyone can complain. Plus, there is no long wait!

I hope you give this inexpensive place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Their Homemade coconut frozen yogurts delish. Strawberry flavored coconut frozen yogurt was my personal fave. Appreciate the dairy free options n also the sweetest mom n pop ice cream/ fro yo shop.
author: ThuZ W.

description:
Sunday afternoon, late September, temperature pushing 90 degrees.  We had just finished brunch and were walking down Valencia.  It was hot and my daughter asked if we can get some ice cream.  Fantastic idea honey!  We were equal distant between Xanath and Bi-Rite.  We decided on Xanath because we've never stopped in... plus you know that line at Bi-Rite. 

Have to echo others. Even on a hot day their ice cream is dull. Not worth going out of the way.
author: Zoran L.

description: Yay no wait. Love that dense texture of their ice cream.. yum!
author: Yad L.

description: Cute little ice cream shop with random rave lights in the back area. They're supposedly known for their different vanilla ice cream (tahitian, mexican, and regular) but all did not taste good to me. One tasted like marshmallows, and one was too icy in texture. However, I really liked their brown sugar banana chocolate chip ice cream. I'm also glad the ice cream here is reasonably priced, especially by the hip area of the mission.
author: Janet H.

description: Xanath is an ice cream shop located conveniently right in the heart of the Valencia corridor. They are ostensibly organic in their approach, and everything is reasonably inexpensive given some incredibly popular ice cream alternatives within walking distance that shall not be named. Overall, the flavors are decent: not amazing, but not bad. A decent choice for dessert, especially if you're coming from dinner nearby.
author: Vincent L.

description: Delicious creamy dairy free coconut milk yogurt in mango and vanilla, get it swirled in a cone for $1.50!  Way better than yogurtland consistency and hecka cheaper. Not a lot of room inside but very homey feel with natural wood tables and fresh saffron for sale.
author: Sarah Y.

description:
That early Monday evening was a perfect time to have a great ice cream sundae to beat the record breaking heat before the next few days had gotten cooler.  I decided to head to Xanath Ice Cream to have scoops of both Mexican vanilla bean and saffron once again.  Both flavors are must-haves since they're made to taste perfectly.  No other ice cream parlors besides Xanath have a taste of pure saffron.  It's been so long to have a taste of it on my second visit while a Mexican vanilla bean on my first visit.  This vanilla flavor is unlike any regular vanilla flavor from Dreyer's and Häagen-Dazs.  It's easy to get comfortable with a regular taste of vanilla most of us around the world indulge in.  So I chose to go for a different vanilla flavor.  Not just organic like Three Twins, but made with all natural ingredients, no gums, no stabilizers, no artificial flavors and colors.  Also, this vanilla has its flavor so real that tasting it takes me back to where it's born, in Veracruz Mexico.  And that is how I will enjoy the real taste of vanilla, intense and robust, the very best!  As for the other ice cream flavors in Xanath, they're all just as good.  Why?  Because they're organic.  Speaking of organic, there's just one flavor that barely answer my scream.  That's right!  I'm talking about the beyond organic huckleberry!  I wish the healthiest ice cream flavor will come back from its absence.

I take it from certain people who made bad reviews.  When one person said their green tea ice cream tasted powdery, it shows that everyone has different taste and different perspective.  But no matter what, we must do our part to save the environment by recycling and composting, and eating cruelty free food.  Here's hoping to keep business in Xanath running.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Xanath is a super underrated spot for uniquely-flavored ice cream in the Mission. I love that it's open late, has a rotating selection of cool flavors (had huckleberry last time I went), and its oversized sugar cone. Be sure to try their saffron or saffron ginger! Reasonable prices, far shorter lines than Bi-Rite, and good service.
author: Tim X.

description: Love how reasonable the prices are here. I got a small vanilla soft serve in a cone for $2. My fiance got a small scoop of espresso ice cream in a cone for $3. They were both great! Service was friendly and let you sample from their many flavors. There's two tables and a bench to sit at inside. Overall definitely a good option for ice cream in the neighborhood.
author: Linda X.

description:
We were on our way to bi-rite when we passed by this place and decided to just go here instead. We walked in a wooooow everything here is organic, pretty awesome!  The girl behind the counter seemed like she didn't want to be bother but she probably had a long day.

Anyhow, we tried a few flavors and even though they were good they seemed as if they were lacking sweetness, o well I guess that's the price you have to pay for organic ice cream. I ended up getting the almond flavor they have, and my fiance got their espresso flavor.  The espresso flavor was actually really rich and flavor packed, while the almond flavor was good but not sweet enough in my opinion, however it was still good.  We also got their organic sugar cones and they're great.

I will definitely come back to try some of their other flavors.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
With prices of premium ice cream approaching $5.50 a scoop, this place a truly a bargain. Organic, milky ice cream from $2.99 for a single, it's a bargain - sad, but true. I had caheta flavor which i thought would be condensed goat milk, but it will just cow condensed milk. Still good though. 

We came a few minutes before they were going to close, and the door was locked. The girl reluctantly unlocked the doors for us. Not a lot of words from her-- must have been a long day.
author: William H.

description: The ice cream is delicious and consistent. I consider myself to be a mint chip connoisseur and this mint ice cream is perfectly on point. There's no green dye, check! Great sized chocolate pieces, check! and it has the perfect amount of sweet minty flavor, check!  The local family who owns this shop is also delightful, the staff is nice and the location is kept nice and clean.  Also, we like supporting them - have you seen the new bike racks out front and the new neon sign? They're clearly trying to keep up with the changing neighborhood - support this sweet little shop!!
author: Autumn B.

description: Literally my favorite ice cream place in sf. Simple quality homemade ice cream at reasonable prices. Less trendy than birite or smitten, but honestly I prefer the ice cream here on a regular basis.
author: Alex L.

description:
I was wrong about this place, there was some slight misunderstanding initially and the manager emailed me and realized how good of customer service and appreciation they have.
In addition their frozen yogurt is some of the best in SF
Highly recommended
author: Jad A.

description: I came here after dinner, and I was pleasantly surprised. It was not busy at all, and the flavors were definitely unique. I settled on the vanilla buffala milk soft serve, and it was SO GOOD! It was super creamy and delicious! I will definitely come back here when I'm in the area.
author: Rachel H.

description: Xanath does this really delicious soft serve that is reasonably priced and really much more convenient than Bi Rite is. If you need really simple ice cream, Xanath is your place.
author: Christina S.

description:
I quite enjoyed Xanath...good prices for the quality of ice cream, which is ORGANIC!  There were many flavor variations of vanilla, and they also seemed to push the uniqueness of their saffron (there was an entire wall display for these two spices). 

You can get 2 flavors in a single scoop ($2.99), and their sugar cones are not your typical sugar or waffle cone, but still good. I loved my roasted almond and figm especially the almond. 

Their workers looked so miserable though. Yes it was close to the end of the night, but c'mon..I've worked at an ice cream shop and I know that ice cream makes people happy...so be happy, or at least look it, please? You're bringing me down.
author: Ling X.

description: I get the frozen yogurt every time. Also their Mexican Cajeta(dulce de leche) flavor is so creamy and their staff is always so kind
author: Gloria Z.

description: Cheap ice cream while not being sketchy/low-quality? They even have variety, so it's not like buffet quality ice cream. You can get regular ice cream, vegan ice cream, frozen yogurt, organic stuff, you name it. Compared to the other ice cream places in the city, the ice cream here is a steal. Unless you're an ice cream snob (why though), you won't be disappointed and your wallet will thank you.
author: Michael M.

description:
Last week, during that epic heat wave SF was having -- I found myself wandering around the Mission for some window shopping, when suddenly I found this gem of an ice cream shop and needed a swift, ice cold pick-me-up after a day of sweltering upper 80's heat. 

I thought finding ice cream at the peak of my heat stroke had made my day. perused the selection of green tea ice cream, chocolate this and that, and settled on a sea salt caramel frozen yogurt. 

I get to the counter, and he tells me my total: 0.99. 

My mind was blown. Maybe twice. Partially because, well, this is San Francisco and I'm pretty sure a piece of gum is marked up 150% more than the rest of the country. And also, because the last time anything was 0.99 was the time of Warhol or something. Or circa Fresh Prince of Bel-Air. Definitely before most tech millionaires were born. 

Alas, that 0.99 sea salt caramel froyo made my day. My week, even. He tried to give me my penny in change, but, like a baller, I said, "nah, you can keep it.";P

I walked a few blocks and sat at a bench outside a store, when a couple walked my way and sat right next to me, holding the same ice cream cones. I looked at them and said, "Holy crap, did you get that for 0.99?!" And I kid you not, we bonded over our three 0.99 ice cream cones for five minutes straight. It's a wonder how much something so cheap can seem so mutually glorious. Actually, never mind. It just IS effing glorious.
author: Ellie W.

description:
Good ice cream done cheap.

Besides having one of the hardest to pronounce names in the ice cream biz, Xanath has some pretty decent ice cream too.  I tried the mango ice cream. Not too sweet. Not too sour. It was good, but nothing to write home about. The prices are dirt cheap and also offer a variety of spices and extracts which is a nice touch for people into making their own sweets. 

Xanath is a good place to get an icy treat.
author: Nadav P.

description:
Very interesting ice cream place! My friends and I stumbled upon it after dinner and were intrigued by the flavor offerings. While the decor was not fantastic, the ice cream was definitely very unique. We sampled everything from fig to dry cherry to brown sugar with banana to saffron ginger. The flavors were all so unique, and as another plus, the ice cream was all organic and very cheap as well--just $2.99 for a single scoop with two flavors! I ended up getting the pumpkin pie and fig on a cone--this was definitely the most unique ice cream cone I've had--it was very long and narrow and tasted like a wafer (very little sugar). However, I wouldn't necessarily say it was good. And while the ice cream itself was decent, it definitely was not the best I've ever had. (For some reason, the fig ice cream melted really fast, and the pumpkin ice cream had a strange crumbly texture.) We also got a large frozen yogurt with the two flavors they offered that night--caramel sea salt and chocolate. While the portion was large and the yogurt creamy, it also had a strange bitter aftertaste to it. 

Overall, this was a very interesting all-organic ice cream store with great value and unique flavors, and I'd definitely come back again just to sample more of their offerings.
author: David K.

description:
what i ordered... mango frozen yogurt

...yogurt was delicious, mango flavor wasn't overpowering and served on a cone of my choosing and cost me just a buck and a half.

ambiance... ok (clean but a bit cluttered)
service... good (nice and helpful)
cost... $- (cheap for the yogurt that it is, especially with the label 'ORGANIC')
author: Gors P.

description:
Man I love this place.

After a night of spending way too much money on dinner in the Mission, being able to get a small scoop of ice cream under $3 makes me feel like I'm back in a city with reasonable rent.

The flavors are really yummy and far more subtle than most places, which I personally prefer. No neon colored ice cream here - the green tea is a true brownish green and the almond ice cream is a creamy white flecked with brown.

Next time you're in the area, consider passing Bi-Rite to give Xanath a try. Like everyone else, I'd really recommend trying the saffron ginger (also guys...saffron is so expensive, we're pretty darn lucky to get it in an affordable ice cream) but I'm also a fan of the brown sugar banana chocolate chip. Also the spoons and cups are compostable, which is always great.
author: Dede G.

description: After dinner, I went for a stroll and saw a decent crowd in a small, cozy ice cream shop -- Xanath Ice Cream. We sampled two flavors: saffron ginger, and madagascar vanilla. After getting a taste of madagascar vanilla, I was hooked. It is definitely one of the best tasting ice cream I have had; it was thick and creamy, with just the right amount of flavor. The only reason I am giving this place 4 stars (rather than 5) is because they had a homeless person hanging inside the shop, occupying one of the benches. This was rather strange and kind of off putting, but aside from that, the ice cream was delicious.
author: Peter W.

description: Amazing vegan coconut milk frozen yogurt!
author: Rachel S.

description: We had one scoop of green tea and one scoop of saffron. Both ice cream textures were hard and not creamy at all, maybe because the freezer was too cold? The green tea tasted powdery and didn't really have a green tea flavor, the after taste was bitter. Saffron was good when I sampled it but when I got a scoop of it, it tasted like sashimi (my bf said the same thing and we don't know why). Willing to give Xanath another try but bi rite and polly ann are so much better. There were also cups of waffle cone bits for free, which were on the stale side.
author: Tammy P.

description: Forget pretentious ice cream.  This place is straight up yummy.  Also, their soft serves are cheap and delish
author: John P.

description: The owner of this business served a magnificent  paella and homemade vanilla ice cream at the Conservatiry of  Flowers member party a few years ago.There were goody bags with vanilla beans and saffron for members.It has taken me Too Long to go to their shop.I love the texture of the ice cream.I also like that real spoons are used for sampling.My friend got the child scoop.It was very generous.I got a single scoop on a very good wafer like cone,tall+ slender.We both  had saffron vanilla? flavor.I bought some vanilla beans also.I will be back.
author: I. W.

description:
Nothing beats their saffron ginger and fig flavors of ice cream. It's legal crack. And this is coming from a lifelong chocoholic!
We live in Sacramento but go to Xanath every time we're in SF. It's THAT good. It's that GREAT.
author: Never T.

description: I had the saffron ginger on a cone. Delicious and the right size. Not so much that I felt terrible, but just enough for a tasty treat.
author: Betty C.

description:
Icecream + organic = must have it!

I recently found out that Xanath has celebrated their 7th year in SF! Congrats :) The flauta gift is much appreciated.

Your ice cream is always delectable. &...

Reasonable price. Superb location. Proper nutritional values.

Sate your need for a well crafted treat at this locale.

Gracias, Xanath, for what you offer.
author: Wendell A.

description: Cute shop, with both traditional (various vanillas, chocolate) and adventurous flavors (mango, banana, green tea) --TONS of taste. They even sell the herbs that add flavor to the ice cream. Downside is the bathroom is for staff only. Banana caramel chocolate chip and huckleberry were delish. Good prices for SF ice cream shop, $2-3 for a single scoop cup or cone!
author: Alex C.

description: The vanilla frozen yogurt is literal heaven in your mouth. Better than the real stuff in my opinion.
author: Say Q.

description:
As a serial baker, I come here for the awesome bulk vanilla beans. They're flavorful, plump, super fresh, and sold by the 1/4lb. It's nice that they're organic, but honestly, the price would be good even if they weren't. 

I feel like an expert on their ice cream at this point, because I end up impulse buying a scoop or two every time I stock up here - get the ginger saffron!
author: Brigitte B.

description:
A-OK, I'm upping this place in my book for being consistent.  I've been back since my last review and can't say that it is the best but it does satisfy my sweet craving!

Thank you X for keeping the fig, coffee, and the huckleberry. I'll be back to try the cajeta and the brown sugar banana.  Thanks for also keeping pricing consistent.  Cheers to 2 more stars in my book!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
$2 for a kids scoop of ice cream and $1 for a scoop of yogurt...you really can't get more reasonable than this for high quality tasty ice cream.

They've got a lovely assortment of intriguing flavors from fig to saffron to strawberry and more! 

Every time I pass Xanath, I just can't say no to the saffron ice cream. I make all my dates go in if we pass it. Lol.
author: Michelle N.

description: So tonight my family and I stopped at our favorite ice scream spot in the whole city - Xanath- we have been coming here for years and always recommend to all our friends and newbies to SF. This time we brought the whole gang; my grandmother, aunt, little cousin, dad, mom, brothers- well you get the idea. My little cousin accidentally dropped her one scoop inside while we were still ordering ours. We asked "Samantha" (name given to us by her. Asian young girl wears glasses) if we could please get another one and her response was no, that if we wanted another one we had to buy it. We explained to her that it was an accident and that my little cousin did not even try it yet. Her response was that if it happen outside they can't do anything about it- understandable if that was the case- but it wasn't. We hadn't stepped foot out the door and as I stated earlier we were not finished ordering. Then she changed her policy and said "well I didn't see it happen." Her response was honestly insulting, she practically called us lairs. I was deeply disappointed given the fact that we love this place and brought our extended family for their first time. The experience was awful. I don't believe this is the way any employee should treat their customers. Her attitude was empathic and unapologetic, not to mention rude. Made me consider Mr. Smitten across the street for next time. Unfortunate how one single person can change an opinion of years.
author: Deyana O.

description:
I got their cookies n creme and I liked it a lot!! There are others flavors that I didn't try but they do let you try. 

The prices are scattered. I think in a cup costs extra. 

My two friends and I got one scoop, two scoop, and medium swirl in a cup and it came out to $10. 

They have a showcase that sells saffron and vanilla bean.
author: Ange G.

description:
Didn't try the saffron ginger which people rave about so may have to get back here to try this but my flavor: red walnut chocolate, was just allright. It wasn't bad. I just felt that it was a tad bit too sweet and left a weird after taste.
Compared to my favorite - Bi-Rite, this place  is pretty sore.
Though I have to say, they are reasonable and friendly and located in a very prime spot in the Mission.
Maybe I'll give it another chance and try their more raved about flavors.
author: Kinjal N.

description:
First time here. Sampled the vanilla and coconut flavor, tasted icy and not coconutty. Didn't like it. Wasn't rich and creamy like Bi-rite's or actually, any OTHER ice cream parlor. Tries the toffee caramel, that one was a slap in the face from the sugar. Eggh. I'm not picky with ice cream either, but this place was really disappointing. I also tried the cookies and cream one, and that was gross. None of the flavors were creamy and rich and smooth. Even though they say they don't use artificial additives or what not, all their flavors tasted really artificial and super sweet to me :/

Won't be coming back here again. Plus the shop itself gave me insane asylum vibes.
author: Hanna M.

description:
Vanilla bean is so tasty! Organic and delisious Yummmmm I will come back for sure
Place are good as well
Tried Tahitian coconut vanilla today. Very tasty and rich. Their vanilla ice creams are the best I've tried in SF
author: Yana C.

description:
I found Xanath via Chow (http://www.chow.com/digest/120891/san-franciscos-best-ice-cream-chowhound-lists/) and put it on my list as it's always my goal to find an even better ice cream spot. However, I was sorely disappointed and left to wonder how Xanath managed to make a "best of SF" list.

True, their flavors are pretty distinctive, and fairly strong if you like that. I certainly don't mind it because if you find a flavor or a pairing that works well, then sure you'd want a strong flavor. And all their saffron options are really unique as well.

However, I found the texture a little icy. I really prefer my ice cream to be richer, creamier, smoother. You can tell even by looking at the ice cream tubs in their freezers - there is a layer of ice forming over every flavor. They must keep the temperature too low.

Out of the ones we tried below, we ended up getting the Dutch chocolate & Ginger saffron together. These were a good pair, but a few consecutive spoonfuls of either of them alone and it would have been too intense!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y1CtMGY68B5ZJeH82ok8HA?select=AjedABadbF4APLTGetuxZg

* Dutch chocolate - 3 stars
Rich, intense, good bitterness. A little overwhelming if you have it alone, but good if you counter it with a sweeter, fruitier flavor.

* Ginger saffron - 3.5 stars
This had a really intense strong ginger flavor! I love ginger, so that worked well for me. The saffron seemed more subtle, but maybe I'm not as familiar w/ its flavor and can't pick it out as well.

* Mexican vanilla bean - 2 stars
I was sorely disappointed, especially since everyone raves about the vanilla. In general, vanilla bean is my favorite ice cream flavor and this one was just too sweet and tasted quite artificial.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Ive walked by this place a few times now but not until someone mentioned it again did i step in. Having already had dessert im still a sucker for a good ice cream. Split a small saffron ginger which totally hit the spot. The place is small and doesnt have much room to linger and it's a bit bright for me. However i love the crazy toy display up front and the vanilla bean tower which add a lot of character. So many flavors to try. Im talking to you huckleberry!
author: Kim N.

description:
A MUST COME FOR ICE CREAM. Or Yogurt!
It's cute and their ice creams are BOMBLICIOUS.
They have TOO many flavors to choose from. The girl working is the sweetest! Very kind and allowed us to have a ton of samples!

Please do yourself a favor and stop by to try this! Awesome place on Valencia :)
author: Albia C.

description:
We attempted to go to Bi-Rite Creamery, figuring 9:30pm on a Sunday might allow for a shorter line. Nope we were wrong, at least 50 people waiting in line.  Not wanted to wait 30-40 minutes, we fired up Yelp to see what else was in the area.  Xanath came up so we strolled over to give it a try.    I had a waffle cone with a double scoop of their Mexican vanilla and strawberry.  I have always been a fan of vanilla and this is flat out the best I have ever had.  The amount of vanilla beans that they use in this ice cream gives is a coffee tint.  The flavor is rich, bourbon-y, creamy, amazing.  The strawberry was equally awesome, so fresh, flavorful, not overly sweet.  Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!

Keep up the good work guys!
author: Nick G.

description:
I came in here around 10 one night for some ice cream with some friends. I had never been here before, but the outside intrigued me.

I got the green tea ice cream in a sugar cone, one friend got the mango sorbet, and I forgot what my other two friends got (whoops hehe). All I know is that we all devoured our ice creams. They were creamy, but not too rich, and the cone. Oh.. The cone. Home made and delicious, the best I ever had to be honest. And they were so cheap! In SF I'm always surprised to get ice cream for under $4, and this was $2.99. 

Overall, it's a great place with wonderful ice cream and a cute environment. They have their own vanilla, all organic. 

I definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area//if you want some ice cream!

Side note: Melissa was such a sweetheart, very patient and super friendly (I give a lot of people credit who can stay smiling after a long day of work in customer service)
author: Shira S.

description:
I sampled quite a few. 
Dutch Chocolate, Saffron Ginger, Huckleberry, Mexican Cajeta, Brown Sugar Banana Chocolate Chip (?).

I liked the Huckleberry and the Mexican Cajeta.  The scoops do have little ice crystals in them but they tasted pretty creamy. It wasn't hard, but pretty soft.  The Mexican Cajeta can be too sweet for some because it tastes like condensed milk practically. On the other hand, the Huckleberry wasn't too sweet.  

Service was friendly.
They have a mix of housemade ice cream as well was Strauss ice Cream.  These two flavors are housemade.
author: Heejin L.

description: Headed here right after dinner at Lolo's and it was divine! The perfect palate cleanser. Fig ice cream, I mean...come on. Such a unique flavor but not too overpowering. And it's organic!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Located in Mission, parking is very difficult. I typically just take BART to either 24th street or 16th. Little shop with no seating inside or outside. As to their products, they use Straus Milk and organic ingredients. 

We were walking around Mission trying to kill some time waiting for Urban Putt and walked by. What caught my eye was one side of their windows: they have a whole bunch of Star Wars memorabilia!  :) Of course I HAD to walk in and support my fellow nerds/geeks! Even though we came in about 5min before they closed, the girl  was still very friendly and helpful. 

Tried:
Saffron Ginger
Brown Sugar Banana Chocolate Chip
Huckleberry

Child Scoop $1.99
One Scoop $2.99
Two Scoops $3.99
Pint $5.99

Affogato $3.95

I had initially wanted an affogato since I was falling asleep and we were initially looking for a coffee shop that was open, but they already closed up their machine for the espresso =( Ended up getting the Saffron Ginger & my friend got the Huckleberry (apparently that's one of the popular flavors here). The ice cream was very creamy and had very little ice crystals, nearly gelato-like. Sweetness wasn't too much. I LOVED how strong the ginger was as I'm a HUGE fan of ginger. No subtlety here! Would come back just for the Saffron Ginger :D
author: Kitty K.

description: I took a visit on the Halloween night. The owner is very nice. He welcomed kids with soft serves and posters. They have a lot of interesting flavors of ice creams. The fig one tastes interesting. You will get free very tall cone when you order 2 or 3 scoops.
author: Thanawut A.

description:
I like Xanath for two reasons: It's close and it's cheap. For those days where I don't feel like waiting in line at Bi-Rite, Xanath is there for me.

However, the ice cream here isn't anything fancy. If anything, it's a little salty (?). Still, can't beat $2.
author: Casey S.

description: Incredible ice cream in colorful space. Free soon tasting, fig ice cream, Mexican  Vanilla Bean & Salted Carmel. Super good cones.
author: Patricia A.

description:
I saw that Xanath was closeby so after dinner, I made my friends go inside with me.

They stay open pretty late. I appreciate this because we got there late hah.

I tried a few flavors but ultimately chose to get the brown sugar banana chocolate chip ice cream again....seriously, it's the best. I got one scoop in a waffle cone and that was honestly really amazing. 

I recommend.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Solid place to add to the ice cream shop rotation! I tried the saffron which is heavenly but ended up getting the brown sugar banana chocolate chip--soooooo goood! 

Prices are much lower than comparable fancy ice cream places. We went on a weeknight and there was only one person working. She was really nice even when the line got long. The girl in front of us tried maybe 5 different flavors before deciding... there should be a two try limit when others are waiting.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
How does one mess up vanilla? I don't know. And given that they hand out a vanilla bean stalk, one would think they would master the art of good vanilla flavor.

It's not only the weird texture that throws me off, but that awful aftertaste afterword. Almost like silicone in my mouth. Like I was eating synthetic ice cream from the future.

Their odd flavors also throw me off, like saffron and other spices that seem to belong a spice rack rather than in ice cream.

I would choose Breyers over this place..as in Breyers packaged ice cream.

I'm giving this place 3 stars because their customer service was good.

Maybe I can take this vanilla bean and grow myself an ice cream tree....
author: Jack R.

description: This place was horrible, I don't know why they have 4 stars. The ice cream flavor selection was slim, the flavors I tried were just okay, and the price was high for small scoops. This is a really crappy ice cream place, nothing special, no yummy flavors, no special cones or toppings, this place is the definition of mediocre. neverrrr going back.
author: Sirena F.

description:
I was walking down Valencia was I was smacked upside the head with the most amazing vanilla smell ever. I was determined to find the source...turns out it was across the street and about eight store fronts down from where I was. Xanath Ice Cream. 

If you want wackadoo flavors and lots of stuff in your ice cream (not saying that's a bad thing), head over to Humphrey Slocumbe. If you're in the mood for the simplest, creamiest, richest, flavorful-est ice cream you've ever had, Xanath is your place. Every single flavor is delicious, and there are different vanilla flavors to choose from--how can you beat that?

Plus, it's a great place to buy vanilla beans at really reasonable prices!
author: Dara M.

description:
This place is so underrated. I could've sworn I had written a good review before but apparently not. The people who work here are always soooo friendly and they let me sample as many flavors as I want without making me feel like an ass. 

Must try:

Tahitian vanilla (not Mexican vanilla): soooo rich and delicious! They use real vanilla beans and the flavor really shows. I know it's so "vanilla" of me to like vanilla, but this is an awesome place to rekindle your love for this classic affair. 

Brown sugar banana chocolate chip: this is delicious. Just try it. I love the big chunks of chocolate chips and the banana/brown sugar flavor. Mmmm so good. 

When you're too lazy to wait in line for birite or you're so over paying $4+ for a scoop of ice cream, come here. High quality and friendly service. Highly recommend!
author: Michelle K.

description: So so so yummy. I dream about this ice cream so fresh creamy and delicious. Go eat at lolo and then come here for dessert. I got the coffee ice cream which was one of the best I have ever have.
author: Samar S.

description: seriously one of my favorite ice cream places.  also nice that it's one of the old school places, not all these hipster places trying to take over san francisco.  saffron is a must-try for newbies
author: Mabel F.

description:
Ice Cream: amazing! Love love love Saffron Ginger. Came back to the east coast and I swear I still think about it. Nothing compares.

Service/Decor: terrible. The woman behind the counter acted like she was doing me a huge favor and was judging me for asking for a new spoon when I dropped mine. They could really do something with the space and make it worthwhile, like a cute little sit down cafe. I promise you more people would stop over considering all of the restaurants in the mission area. There's an idea X!
author: Dev C.

description:
Xanath was the second stop on the Yapsie Pupcrawl and I was eager for some yummy ice cream on this hot day. They're known for their vanilla and saffron flavors and the flavors are infused in every bite. In fact, you're supposed to enjoy their ice creams like a fine wine. Just let it melt on your tongue and allow the flavors to develop.

I tried the banana cream with chocolate chips. It had something else in it but I forget what it is now. Either way, it was delicious! I also got to sample some of their vanilla and saffron flavors and they were subtle, yet loaded with layers of flavor.

Xanath has some great flavors and there's bound to be something for everyone. They even offered us a complimentary vanilla bean to take home and I might even use it for my own ice cream creations. There's plenty of outdoor benches for your dog to hang out at too. They'll watch longingly for some ice cream to drip off and love you more for it. Enjoy your scoop and your day with your pooch!

Food: 9/10

Service: 9/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Ice Cream: Flavorful and delicious. Comparable to Humphrey and Bi-Rite.

Service: Nope. The employee carelessly tried to hand me the sample spoon over the counter which resulted in the ice cream dropping on the ground near my foot. No apologies. I awkwardly asked if there were napkins to wipe it up and she handed me some. I then proceeded to wipe up the ice cream she dropped from the ground. I then asked if there was a garbage can, thinking she (the employee!) would take it from me and throw it away behind the counter. How silly of me because what she did instead was point to a trash can across the room. WHAT. It's kind of ridiculous the employee who dropped ice cream on the ground made me (the customer!) pick it up and throw it away. 

Shenanigans.
author: Yanni L.

description:
Wow, I really thought the Cajeta ice cream was incredible...cajeta is fairly hard to find (I think) in the city and to have cajeta-flavored ice cream was great.  It really had a rich and creamy flavor and wasn't overpowering with excessive sweetness.

Xanath seems to get hot-or-miss reviews from Yelp, but their cajeta is definitely worth a visit!
author: Ken G.

description:
My favorite ice cream spot in the city hands down! The ice cream is amazing and well worth the price. They also have bommmbb sugar cones which look super long and funky but pair really nice with ice cream (the cashier told me they get them all the way from Spain!). 

The ice cream itself is super creamy, smooth, and packed full of flavor. They have all the classic flavors as well as nontraditional ones too. 

Customer service is a hit or miss tho I've had both good and bad but the ice cream is so good here I can't really complain.
author: Anna H.

description:
VEGAN review: I got the mango sorbet, which was quite good but it's just like any mango sorbet you get anywhere. Mango-y and sorbet-y. 

It was $1.99 for a scoop in a cone, and cones are always fun.
author: Dorothy T.

description:
randomly wandered in here, and was very pleasantly surprised.

it was shockingly reasonable for organic ice cream/frozen yogurt. i sampled the mexican cajeta (dulce de leche), which was so rich and caramelly and sweet without being cloying. ended up getting the $0.99 special mango frozen yogurt in a sugar cone. not sure if it's because i haven't had a sugar cone in a while or what, but it was crunchy and really nice. the frozen yogurt was uber mangoe-y and creamy, and nicely sweetened. it was frozen yogurt, so that's healthy, right?
author: Heather F.

description:
Back to Xanath for more of their totally awesome ice creams and sobets!

This time on the list:
Madagascar Vanillia:  Everything you want in a Vanillia and even more.  Super fresh as always. 

Saffron:  A very understated saffron from my point of view.  (I eat lots of saffron)  It's everything you want in an ice cream with the saffron contributing even more to the creamy texture/flavor of the experience.  Those wanting a little more kick should get the saffron-ginger version.

Strawberry Lemon Coconut Sorbet:  Think of it as Strawberry sorbet with a kick, and a little side trip down coconut lane.   The lemon and coconut flavors activate on you tongue a second after the strawberry hits it.  This is a sorbet  that self-cleans your palette while your senses beg for more!

Banana, (something) (something):  Think of  Xanath's Banana ice cream as a banana bomb going off in your mouth!  If you have ever wanted the flavor of fresh banana ice cream then this is your answer!   Also included in the mix are little chocolate nibs, vanilla,  and some other flavors I don't remember in the name,  In all respects this can be a way to cheat and get a banana split put inside in cone.  I think the pint I brought home is going missing soon! 

Huckleberry:  This ice cream was a surprise to my mouth I did not take home (I already had four pints going with me!)   I be back for some later one.  Think of it as a toned-down blueberry with a little  blackberry twist.

The sad thing about my visit was the family was at home.  So pints to go along with tasting at least half to the flavors before I left.  it was a Yum Fest with a continuance in mini style later on.


My thanks to the Sunday night staff on 10/6/2013 whose wrist tolerated my large take-out order. Especially the wrist wrenching sorbet that provided an entire week's workout in the span of 5 minutes!
author: Chris R.

description:
Anyone who has come here at the end of 4/20 after getting off at either 16th or 24th St. BART stations knows how treacherous the walk can be. Xanath is located 5 blocks from either station, which feels more like 5 miles when you have an urgently agonizing craving for ice cream.

Xanath has a fantastic variety of rare flavors, such as huckleberry and pumpkin pie. SF ice cream shops are notorious for going all out on new flavor creation, so I'm not surprised. I got a scoop of Red Walnut Chocolate and Mango Xanath. Both flavors are very creamy and complement each other well. The chocolate has a nice crunch to it with the walnuts. 

I'd say Xanath is on par with Bi-Rite, just in a quieter and not as crowded setting. Definitely worth a try if you've got a major case of the munchies.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
Yes!!!!

We were walking and came upon this spot. First off, my son has a milk and nut allergy, so we got him some coconut sorbet and he was happy. 

Organic ice cream for $2 and there were a few flavors to choice from. 

The girl was very friendly and even washed the scoop without any attitude at our request.
author: Roger A.

description:
Saffron ice cream is the flavor to get here. Intensely scented and the rich custard yellow is awesome. I prefer the one with a ginger bump, but if it's your virginal cruise to Xanath, opt for the pure. Also try their different types of vanilla.

The fruit flavors here are a little too dense (especially mango), but in general, solid ice cream that rivals Bi Rite for the crown. Persimmon or fig are also good calls.

Never really a line!
author: Kevin L.

description: I used to LOOOOVE this place for their $.99 cone special but I just went in to get one and now it's only available to seniors!!! WTF?!?!?! Shady. That deal was the only thing getting customers into that store. Too bad, so sad.  Won't go back.
author: L. Boogie M.

description:
A friends and I went on "The Great Mission Ice Cream Tour" one Sunday and decided to try ice cream from all the spots in the Mission, and I have to say, this one was my favorite! 

Why? 
It's a humble little store front, with friendly staff, and amazing ice cream. They continually encourage you to try all the flavors you want (and don't make you feel guilty about it) and were super accommodating and friendly. 

The chocolate ice cream was amazing. And after trying multiple flavors, I can honestly say I did not try a single one I didn't like. 


It doesn't take something grandiose and hyped about to have amazing service and a great product, and Xanath demonstrates that.
author: Marilyn M.

description: After the growing pains, Xanath has become one of the few credits to the "new" hood.  Especially if you like a good deal on fresh, organic vanilla ice cream.  They are obviously committed to making good ice cream, and selling it at a reasonable price (unlike every other ice cream place in the Mission now) so if I didn't need to "update" this review, I would keep it a secret, because you seldom have to wait in much of a line!  The whole experience at Xanath is much closer to what one used to expect from a Mission neighborhood ice cream place, than anything left now.  And that is saying a lot.
author: dan s.

description:
Fate dealt us a wonderful hand when it led us to Xanath

After scoring a FAB dinner at Udupi palace, we wanted a little something something to wash it all down & Xanath was close enough to our theater & time was on our side so opportunity couldn't have been knocking any louder 

Saffron - this was creamy & smooth & very saffronny....winner

Dulce De Leche - this was very milky & creamy but didn't blow our socks off

Coconut was icy & crumbly &the coconut was in microscopic pieces - Mitchell's Macapuno totally blows this coconut out of the water

Also tried a taste of the "famous" Mexican Vanilla & it was likewise icy

So for now, have to say this place is a huge A-OK w/ reserve to bump a few stars upon more tastings
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Despite its good intentions in serving all things organic, I just don't view Xanath as having destination ice cream. Know what I mean? Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous? Looks promising. Humphry Slocombe? Sure. Mitchell's? No argument. Bi-Rite Creamery? Absolutely. But Xanath? Hmmm, not quite. And there's the name. I'm sure it has a deeper symbolic meaning - but it sounds like a cross between Zantac and Xanadu, a kitschy roller-disco musical that gives you ulcers, I guess.

I think it's the texture that's lacking even more than the flavor. I tried a $1.50 scoop of their Tahitian Coconut Vanilla (see photo) on their anniversary weekend last month, and while it had a nice tropical taste to it, there was a milky meltiness I just didn't care for. Vanilla is their thing, so much so that they give free vanilla beans away. What am I supposed to do with this thing? Anyhow, with so many choices in the Mission for quality lactose overloads of all varieties, I think I have to give Xanath the subtle shrug. It's not a gesture I'm proud of, but I do it so well.

ICE CREAM - 3 stars...middling and milky
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...nice enough inside, a bit generic
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...fine from what I recall
TOTAL - 3 stars...if I'm walking on Valencia on a bright sunny day, sure, why not?
author: Ed U.

description:
Visited the day that SF actually sported 99F weather.. just a few days back. 

SHA NATH is how they would like to be called, I do recall.. meaning vanilla. Cute little business idea.... cute shop. Clerk was a bit ambivalent about offering customer service. Not a very 'organic' disposition, if you catch my drift. 

Yes on the fig
No on the saffron
The former was creamy and held a great fresh fig taste. Saffron was way too diluted and muted. Could hardly detect the flavor. 

$3 for a very small portion. Yes, i've frequented Ici, Bi-Rite, Bombay, Slocombe.... 

I'm a little "EHH" about this place. We'll see how it does in the future.

PS Additional kiosk selling their sweets just outside of the Conservatory of Flowers, Golden Gate Park
author: Jana C.

description:
Encouraged to sample every flavor, we kept pointing out flavors to try. Perfect way to get the lay of the land. 

Though exotic sounding & beautifully colored in muted retro hues, saffron ginger, brown sugar banana, & green tea were all "no's." 

Espresso & Dutch chocolate were a-ok, but if I'm going for those (relatively) traditional flavors, I'm going for Humphrey slocombe's blue bottle Vietnamese coffee or their malted milk chocolate. 

I decided on Huckleberry (the most delicious shade of purple...Xanath's ice creams are certainly pretty) & Madagascar vanilla. Delicious, not so thick & buttery that it leaves a film on the tongue, & boasts all organic ingredients, but I'm hooked on another ice creamery. I know what I like, & I like what I know.
author: Fancypants X.

description: Great people and great ice cream. The soft serve is ideal for kids!! Far less expensive than birite and awesome.
author: Boone S.

description: Ordered a double scoop. It was served on a ridiculously huge cone. People were staring. Was pretty funny. Good ice cream.
author: Will D.

description: Came here on a fluke and noticed they had Organic ice cream and thought why not....oh my word...the saffron ginger ice cream is amazing. Yes I know it sounds gross, but if you're already walking around the "culinary hipster flava flav" streets of Valencia, then you should be down to try most things once. Don't knock it until you try it, they will let you taste it for free.
author: Victoria S.

description: First timer for Xanath ice cream, while I was strolling around in Valencia street and I craved for something matcha. I see the sign for $ 2.99 for ice cream and when I came inside I found what I was looking for! Matcha ice creamm :). Overall tasty, but the size is somewhat smaller than other competitors ( Bi-rite, Humphry ). Def come back!
author: Gabriella S.

description:
Such a random little location for an ice cream shop.  It fits in perfectly with the vibe and flow of the Mission on Valencia street.  I just wish more people new about it - instead I feel as if most people are unaware of it's existence and just continue walking by.

the ice cream is good.  I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had and with tough competitors in the field located just a few blocks away, it's hard to compete.  This is a nice little spot to wet your mouth after wandering back from a nice dinner somewhere along the way.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Really yummy. Great variety of favors and very fresh.  I love a basic frozen yogurt vanilla and chocolate swirl in a cup and I could actually get that... My husband had the Carmel ice cream with espresso over it, and it was delicious... Served in a coffee cup so you could drink it after if you took too long.  Great location.


Con:  not a pleasant staff... At least when we were there.  The two girls were quite rude.
author: Lyndsey C.

description: The frozen yogurt (soft serve vanilla, chocolate, or twist) is average, but the sign explaining the pricing/sizing (for frozen yogurt) is bizarrely cryptic, and the clerk didn't seem able to give me a straight answer either. I suspect they call the larger size "slightly larger" because it's still too small to be called large.
author: Kira K.

description: My friend took me to this ice cream place on Valencia. I normally don't walk far enough on Valencia to come across this place. The selections were okay. There's a lot of coffee flavors. I wanted something fruity, so I had huckleberry. One scoop in a cake cone. It costed $2.99. It was good, but I am not dying to come back here. Rather go to Bi-Rite, but the line is always too long there.
author: Denise C.

description: One of the best ice cream places we eaten at. Every flavor we tried was so good we got a scoop. We tried mango, saffron and dark chocolate walnut. For organic ice cream this is reasonably priced. Top it all, it's on valencia, we love that area!!
author: Kay P.

description:
i used to eat ice cream here.. and then i went to another place and realized how I missed the xanath stuff. The new place's ice cream just didn't hit me.. left me hollow. no flavour. so back to xanath. yummy deep flavorful ice creams and an unpretentious mood which i really like.. no in your face branding etc love it. highly recommend it to everyone.
and yeah.. i like that odd vanilla tower display too.. weird first and then on the next few visits - hey, there you are...
author: Malvika B.

description: I think I just wasn't ready for how creamy the ice cream was. A plus to the cream was the portions. Went in expecting a small scoop, but was surprised with how large the scoop size were.
author: Devika B.

description:
In this city, proclaiming one's choice of ice cream provider is akin to a politician proclaiming their recommendation of arms dealer: everyone will judge you for it and you'd better back up your claims with demonstrable evidence.

Though I'm not quite ready to declare my allegiance to any one creamery (I haven't forgotten about you, Bi-Rite), it's the hole-in-the-wall lack of frills that first drew me to Xanath as I walked down Valencia. My curiosity was rewarded with a tasty double scoop in an organic cone. How fresh? Well - and this appears to be a point of contention with some people - there were still a few not-fully-crushed bits of rock salt to be found. But I love that! I can't speak for anyone else, but that adds a human element to my enjoyment. Somehow the idea that actual human beings slowly stirred these natural selections resonated with me more than if they had been the usual texture.

Plus they've gotten better at it and the rock salt bits are now nearly indistinguishable from the actual pieces of cherry, blueberry, what-have-you.

So give this indie creamery a chance if you're in the Outer Mission. They also sell pints, quarts, and gallons, if you're so inclined.
author: Charles L.

description:
The BEST chocolate ice cream I've ever had was at Xanath. 

Not only was the Dutch Chocolate rich, creamy and the perfect icy temperature, it was reasonably priced and the service was friendly. 

I've had their huckleberry and it is good as well, but nothing can beat their chocolate. It was so good upon sampling I ordered a double scoop on a waffle cone (you get the waffle cone for free when you order two scoops!). However, this was so rich and perfect, there was no way I could eat two scoops. 

I loved it so much and gave such rave reviews, my best friend ordered a scoop of her own without tasting it and agreed it was incredible. 

I also bought a small size bottle of their vanilla and look forward to baking with it. It was priced very reasonably. The girl working the counter was accomodating and helpful, not to mention just all around nice. 

I will definitely be back, this place is a hit. I personally liked their chocolate better than Bi-Rite.
author: Bianca U.

description:
To be honest, not in my top 3 (Ice cream competition is tough in the 7x7). However, it was good friendly service and no line. To me this was one of those 3 or 4 star places where the service bumped it up.

I tried all 3 vanillas and I wasn't too impressed. i got the Madagascar and also some Huckleberry.

The big sell is the whole organic vanilla bit, and you could definitely tell it was organic. The vanilla had a gritty texture to it, not quite sand but it was there. It didn't bother me, it was just different.

Huckleberry was pretty good. It looked and tasted like ube ice cream, and I'm not really a huge fan of Ube ice cream but I liked the Huckleberry.

Service: Little things make big differences in the ice cream game. I tried 5 or 6 ice creams before purchasing and the woman helping me never acted like I was being a diva. We even started talking about Yelp. 

Also when I decided which flavor to get she asked me which one I wanted on the bottom. I was stunned and had to take a moment to think.After all my ice cream adventures I have not been asked this before. Also, it felt like strategy, hmm do i save the vanilla for now or later, dun dun dun! I opted vanilla bottom. Since I am still alive to Yelp about it, I think I made the right decision (who knows what would happen if I picked vanilla top!)

I'd be back here to try saffron or some sorbets but there are other ice creams which I just like better so it would probably be when I'm already in the area.
author: Glenn M.

description: All organic ice cream. Way less of a hassle than Bi-rite or Mitchells. Try the huckleberry!
author: Syncere S.

description:
I love Bi-Rite. I love Humphrey-Slocombe. I love Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous. I loved Bombay Ice Creamery, when it was in business.  I love organic ice cream made from mostly-local ingredients, without additives (that's why Mitchell's never makes the cut for me).  BUT, let me tell you why I LOVE Xanath.  It's understated in that it's situated in between a few homes on Valencia under a small awning. You'd drive right past it if you didn't know to look for it.  In fact, they've now put some small benches and a giant ice cream cone sign outside to attract attention.  (Good for them!)

They make their own vanilla ice cream from actual vanilla beans, and not extract.  Thus, their vanilla flavors look like black-and-white hot mess.  BUT, it's so delicious.  I like the mundane to the extravagant flavors they carry.  (Sometimes, it's saffron-ginger or fig-&-red-walnut in their freezer case that catches my fancy.)  They also have frozen yogurt, and decent prices.  For what they offer- and array of seasonal, fun, local flavors to the best vanilla and chocolate, plus frozen yogurt: 2 stars.

The young lady behind the counter gives you tastes with a huge smile, using reusable silverware even after I've asked for a sample of EVERY ice cream they have in the store.  (I'm not that bad, but I'm sure you get my drift.)  I love the sustainability that they incorporate into their business practices.  They also use compostable corn plastic cups if you choose to have your ice cream in a cup, and not a cone- the original compostable/edible vessel.  So, I love their sustainable service with a smile.  That deserves 2 stars.

The fifth star is because I don't have to wait in a line outside, sectioned off by stanchions, hanging out in the cold, or the heat, or the rain for a taste of heaven.  This place isn't as well-known as Humphrey-Slocombe and Bi-Rite, and doesn't attract the ridiculous lines of people all hankering for a piece of frozen goodness.  And, that's the way I like it.  Although, now, maybe other people will catch on, and my line grows longer at Xanath.  Good for them.  I want them to stay in business.
author: Angela T.

description:
I decided to stop after seeing a sign for the Anniversary this weekend: July 20-21, 2010 1 scoop ice cream $1.50 & frozen yogurt cone 50c

Lots of flavors sounded good to me.  I got a tiny sample of saffron ginger & tiny sample of peach.  I liked both, but got Roasted Almonds a NEW flavor instead on a sugar cone.  $1.50 for the anniversary price, regular price $2.99.

They also gave out Vanilla Bean in the pod.  That was nice. 

I got a Frequent Buyer Reward Card 1 marked off.  After 10 purchases, u get a FREE one-scoop of ice cream or 1 medium frozen yogurt!

1 scoop $2.99
2 scoop $3.99
children's cup $1.99

organic froyo
M $2.99
L $3.99

organic milkshake
M $3.99
L $4.99

topping .50

Hrs:
Su-Th 12-10p
F-Sat 12-11p
author: Ann L.

description:
great light tasting.  normally after a scoop, I feel like its too much.  Either too sweet towards the end or heavy.  Not this though.  Was light tasting till the last lick.  

Did have to wait.  There was only one person working and the line moved really slow for only 2 people in front of me waited about 15mins.
author: Maeling L.

description:
Omg
Best ice cream in the world 
I take my family 
My co workers here everyday 
All the flavors are to die for 
Don't hesitate to try your favorite flavor 
They are amazing
author: Gurneet K.

description: I've been going here for awhile. This place has great ice cream. They have a great madagascar vanilla, yum. A cone is like $2, the service is friendly, and there's never a line. How can you beat that?
author: Trevor O.

description:
I'd give Xanath 4.5 stars if I could, but I can't, so there we are. 

The ice creams at Xanath are as good as any I've had, anywhere and for any price.  Some are basic but fantastically complex and satisfying, others are a bit fancy, but don't suffer for it.  In short, I've never had an ice cream from Xanath that wasn't excellent, and some of their flavors (say, saffron-lemon, fig, or dulce de leche) are orgasmic.

The shopping experience is, unfortunately, very spotty.  One young woman who works there who is delightful, always ready with a smile and an eagerness to make your experience as good as possible.  There are also employees who are clearly there for a paycheck and nothing more.  

But far more annoying to me are some of the patrons who have recently "discovered" Xanath, and who piss me off to no end.  These typically fit one demographic: women in their late-20s to mid-40s who are not originally from San Francisco (indeed, they have "suburbs" stamped on their foreheads in day-glo orange).  They also carry purses that looks like inflated armadillos made from used inner-tubes and glitter.

First, they want to sample 5 different flavors, and they have to muse over each as if the balance of the universe rested upon their decision.  Finally, they order 2 different flavors, in a cup.  After it's been scooped up, they say "I changed my mind; I want it on a waffle cone".  The server dutifully throws out the ice cream and scoops up new product onto a waffle cone.  Total elapsed transaction time: 2 ice ages.
