By this time, 97 people are now waiting behind her to place their orders; half of them have parking meters that are going to expire within 10 minutes, but it will be 3 weeks and 4 hours before they can leave the shop.  Then, our customer has to search through her purse for her debit card to pay for her cone, while taking a phone call from a friend, which we all get to overhear.  "And then *I* said, 'no way'!  I mean, I dunno, you know?"

While paying, she flubs inputting her PIN, drops her keys on the floor and stands at the counter, licking her ice cream while slowly putting her belongings back into her purse, fluffing her hair, putting her sunglasses back on, all while holding her cone like the carcass of some mysterious animal that fills her with revulsion and fascination in approximately equal measures.  By the time she wanders out the door, her transaction has taken only slightly less time than the entire America's Cup series.  

If only Xanath could find some way to send the customers I described to Bi-Rite, the world would be a much better place, and Xanath would have a solid 5 stars from me.
author: Curran H.

description: Great ingredients. Interesting flavors. Excellent service. And it doesn't have the crazy lines that other central-SF ice cream shops are plagued by. Definitely my favorite spot to walk to!
author: Jenny W.

description: The ginger saffron is spicy good -- though the version at Bombay Ice Creamery (long departed from the neighborhood) is still my favorite. I noticed there's frozen custard, so I'm excited to try that next.
author: Vanessa H.

description: It's my first time trying out this place. We actually just passed by it on our way to our dinner, we tried it when we got back. The flavors I tried: toffee and cookies and cream!!! I have to try the other flavors before I make judgement. But so far it's amazing!!! Tho Mitchell's is still the best, bi rite has nothing on this one.
author: Range B.

description:
Best place to buy Vanilla beans in San Francisco. I once paid $10 for 3 beans at a local specialty shop, and this place sold me 4 ounces of beans for $10 and then threw in a free bean as a gift.

I will return to try their Vanilla ice cream, but frankly, with their bean I made my own that was pretty good ;)

Service was friendly too.
author: Jordan C.

description: I think this used to be some sort of chiropractic place so I was surprised when I saw a lot of people around it. As I walked closer it's now an ice cream place. The lady at the counter was nice enough to ask if I wanted a sample while I was looking at the menu, but I politely declined. I decided to get an organic orange soda float with a scoop of Cookies and Cream ice cream. So yummy and creamy. The orange soda can showed it had a lot of sugar in it, but at least not it's not the bad high corn fructose syrup on most sodas.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Sorry folks but this place is overrated. I've been a few times and each time ALL of us in the group complain there's not much flavor going on. Add some freakin' flavor and sugar PLEASE. Like, okay. :P

Bonus star for the batman in the window.
author: Giordano G.

description: I love love love this place!!! My Xanath-fueled huckleberry ice cream lifestyle started off as me having no idea that it was actually just any old [irresistibly delicious] berry and thinking it was some old school reference to The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn. Though I may have just lot all my credibility in the food dept, I can assure you that I'm merely a bookworm who KNOWS GOOD ICE CREAM. I make it a point to have Xanath conveniently on my way home from dinner or the park at least once(??) a week. And get the huckleberry ice cream -- if not for your sugar addiction or dairy addiction, do it for me. It's worth taking a Lactaid for if you're lactose intolerant like my BF.
author: Olivia T.

description: Actually stumbled upon Xanath after fantastic dinner at Bissap Baobab, nearby!  The chocolate icecream is fantastically smooth and wonderfully flavored, especially when matched with the vanilla...and the huckleberry!  The staffer was so generous with our tasting requests - there were four of us, and we must have tasted 2 or 3 flavors each, ending up by walking out with two HUGE cups of multiple flavors to share.  There are a couple of rickety benches outside to sit on, and the place isn't sparkling clean, but the ice creams are good, and it's a quirky local business - buy local, and eat yummy ice cream, because, why not?
author: Cheryl N.

description: Went on a really hot day. You know one of those rare SF over 85 degrees days. Stopped here and got ice cream. So good. So amazing. I've never had huckleberry before and this place is so delicious. Supposedly they have multiple vanillas too if you're a vanilla fan. Go here. So good. The decor of the store is interesting too.
author: Julie L.

description:
The Xanath ice cream is great. They have a lot of unique flavors that I've never seen anywhere else. 

I never know what the tasting limit is at ice cream shops, but didn't want to be a pain to the one person serving and ringing up so I sampled the saffron, fig, and Madagascar vanilla. 

I've only had saffron in risotto before so I was thoroughly surprised and confused when I tried it. I don't think I've had enough saffron in order to truly enjoy this one. The fig flavor was also surprising. I think this flavor would have been more to my taste if it had more tang. The Madagascar vanilla was creamy, sweet, smooth, and had a mellow flavor. It was just what I was looking for. 

I would definitely venture for a return trip to sample the other flavors they have.
author: Tina C.

description:
It was an unusually hot and sunny Friday in San Francisco.  What was I craving?  Oh yes, ice cream!
I stumbled upon this shop as I continued to explore the Mission.  Lucky for me, there was not a crowd.  In fact, I was the only patron.  So, I went on a sample fest until I nailed down my choices.  I ended up selecting a scoop of the pineapple ice cream and a scoop of the mango sorbet.  The combination was delightful, have you ever imagined what a tropical island vacation would taste like?  It would probably taste like these two flavors together.  They were very natural, on par with eating the actual fruits (plus no aftertaste). 
As I finished up my treat, the place filled up quickly.
So yes, I guess I picked the right ice cream shop.
author: Eena J.

description: I really like the unique flavors. I liked brown sugar banana chocolate chip, saffron ginger, and huckleberry. I was serviced by Santiago, whom was really patient despite the fact that my friend and I asked for several samples. Great service and price for the size of the scoops.
author: Selena M.

description:
After a day of walking around the Mission district we were looking for some ice cream and this place caught our eye.  It advertised itself as an organic ice cream shop with unique flavors.  It was plenty unique. 

 I had never seen cajeta flavored ice cream.  If you don't know about cajeta it's Mexican caramel made from goat milk as far as I understand.  It scored big with me for creativity but it turns out I'm not a huge cajeta guy. My fiance had a scoop of ginger-saffron and a scoop of huckleberry ice cream.  

Those were pretty ridiculous combos and they didn't hedge on the flavors as they really got the spice of the ginger to come through.  This place is a must visit if you want to try something other than cookies and cream.  Actually they had that too so you definitely get as adventurous as you dare.
author: Alex K.

description: The ice cream here is okay but nothing too special.  The banana brown sugar was my favorite, but was still a little too sweet for my liking.  Also, either the girl at the counter was having a bad day or she hates giving people samples - which is no fun.  If you are walking around with an ice cream craving, than Xanath will satisfy that, but it won't blow you away.  If you are spoiled by bi-rite, then you will probably be unimpressed by xanath.  Otherwise, it isn't bad ice cream (I don't think that exists), but it certainly isn't amazing either.
author: Juliana K.

description:
I go here everytime I visit the west coast. Mainly for the Huckleberry ice cream. I've had a few flavors but nothing really beats this semisweet taste. 

They boast mimimal ingredi, and you can really taste the genuine promise.

Another goto flavor isTahitian vanilla coconut.

Do it!
author: Jerry K.

description:
The store was surprisingly empty, but we walked in anyway. Its a shock that these guys dont show up on most people's Ice Cream list of San Francisco.
Some excellent fruit flavors, and the person behind the counter gladly let us sample as many as I wanted to. I tried the lemon-mango, the fig, huckleberry, guava, and saffron-ginger flavors. I finally went with the saffron-ginger, for its incredibly well balanced flavor. Will definitely go again, to check out all the other flavors they have!
author: Gurpreet S.

description: Came in on a Sunday where they closed down the roads. Line was super long but they moved pretty quickly. Like that they use compostable spoons and bowls (they charge a small fee if you request extra spoons because the ones they have are more expensive than plastic ones that fill up landfills). Flavors were amazing, I had the saffron ginger and pumpkin but also tried the fig and madagascar vanilla. Definitely wish they had one of these in Seattle! Love the variety of flavors + cheap price + amazing quality ice cream
author: K N.

description:
This place has great vanilla bean ice cream! I've never had anything like it. 
Service is super friendly & you can try as many samples as you want. I love that mostly everything is organic & environment friendly! I'll definitely be back!
author: Cat M.

description: Ice-cream was really good.  Try the saffron or strawberry flavor. Service was horrible! The lady was mean and unfriendly. We arrived couple min. after opening door was still locked. She saw us and made us wait for another 5 min.  She wasn't helpful either and just seemed like she did not want to be there.
author: Matt S.

description:
Not overloaded on sugar like the rest of the ice creameries in the Mission, and thats probably why it appeals to a palate more sophisticated than 20-somethings. Well curated limited flavors of extremely high quality, specializing in a few such as regional vanillas.
Although there is no ice cream in SF that even comes close to the high fat content in ice creams that are located next to dairies and utilizing pre-commercially skimmed off milks, (at ag universities, typically) this place follows the rule of not putting too much sugar into the product. It is the best in SF in terms of ice cream freshness and organic non preservative filled taste. Kudos to you, Xanath.
author: Nan L.

description:
Yum that was good.  And yes you can get half scoops ( just ask) so you don't have to feel really guilty. So glad the guy in front of me ordered half scoops or I never would have known!
The fig ice cream was out of this world.
author: El B.

description: Very good ice cream! The saffron flavor is really good and very unique! Their affogato's are also SUPER good. PLUS they have a lot of organic things which is always great.
author: Kathleen V.

description: Excellent ice cream! Very flavorful and made with quality ingredients. I recommend trying the saffron ginger ice cream, definitely their most surprising flavor.
author: Pablo R.

description:
Aside from sounding like a place that'd be advertised on tv and followed by a bunch of side-effect disclaimers there's nothing wrong with this place.  It's not the best ice cream in the world but the price is right, the scoops are big, and there's a couple places to sit inside.  I had a scoop of fig ice cream and some of their sour-tasting vanilla frozen yogurt and I didn't throw any away.  That means it was good, right?  

This is a good place stop when you're in the mission and just want something cold and sweet.  There's enough hot, sweet things elsewhere on this street.
author: James A.

description: After sampling three of their organic ice creams, I opted for the Dulce de Leche in a kid size cup. I savored the creamy, sofly sweet dessert. My husband enjoyed the refeeshing mint chocolate chip and our friend had his usual, the delicate saffron.
author: Wella A.

description: I think this place is very good and reasonably priced for the quality and neighborhood. I got the brown sugar banana caramel choc chip and it was very creamy and despite the weird sounding combination of flavors it was more like a caramel chip with a hint of banana.  The Dutch chocolate was also very good. I wish they had more seating tho.
author: Pilar J.

description:
The best ice cream I've had in sometime.

A friendly staff person told me the ice cream is made only a few blocks away at a facility near Potrero Hill.

I had two flavors in a single scoop cup.

The ginger and the fig were equally delicious.  Great without being overly sweet.  I don't know how I stopped after only one scoop.

I will return!
author: Saul M.

description:
As soon as I walked in, I wanted to try every flavor on the menu. They're unique enough to dazzle, but not too weird that you're turned off after a few licks.

Huckleberry? Yes, please.
Saffron ginger? I'll take two.
Pumpkin pie? You're killing me here.

I ended up with a scoop of chocolate chip mint (white, not unnecessarily dyed green), and espresso. Weird combination? Maybe. Delicious? Definitely.

As far as weird ice cream flavors go, I'd sooner visit Xanath than Humphry Slocombe any day.
author: Adena B.

description: Agree with another yelper, this place is so underrated and no lines!  Lots of amazing flavors, the ice cream is delicious and the prices are so reasonable.  And homemade cones....so good!  Our server was really nice.  I had a small mint chip on the waffle cone, more than enough of a sweet treat to satisfy.
author: Kathy C.

description: Such a great deal and so delicious! Got a small salted caramel frozen yogurt in a sugar cone, 99¢! It was hella yummy and light yet rich and flavorful.
author: Moni E.

description:
I'm a little jaded because of all these fancy ice cream places. They SAY they have unique flavors, but is saffron ginger really that unique? I wouldn't say so. I'm waiting for the places that take it a step further and do some really unique stuff...like Harry Potter every flavor beans. Okay not that far, but definitely things like corn ice cream (which I did have in New York) and avocado (a coworker told me about this one).

This was not great--had the Saffron lemon orange. Tasted like an otter pop because it was so icy. Wouldn't go back again. If I were you, I would spend the time trying to get into Birite instead.
author: Chrissy H.

description:
Go for Vanilla - there are many different types of Vanilla here, and it is their specialty. Other flavors are nice, but nothing special.

I went for a mix of the Mexican Vanilla Bean and Tahitian Vanilla Coconut and was not disappointed. Now, one could think that there's not much to vanilla icecream, but this place will have you rethinking that standard.
author: David H.

description: Tried the Saffron, Saffron Ginger and Coconut flavors and all were mediocre -- the Saff Ginger so unappetizing that we threw it away. Can't think of a reason why I would come back, with so many other good ice-cream places in the city.
author: Letitia L.

description: This ice cream isn't bad at all. It's super creamy, and pretty much all the flavors are great. There are a couple of downsides, though - it's on Valencia (beware of slow-functioning hipsters), and despite them advertising that they have frozen yogurt, there's really none to be seen or found. Otherwise, the price for the ice cream is very reasonable (banana with chocolate chips, you'll thank me later).
author: Danny C.

description:
What is with the rating for this place?! This is crazy talk. 

Some of the flavors may be bursting with too much flavor...but I kid you not, each one is SPOT ON. natural flavors. no artificial tastes of excess cream or sugar or flavoring. I was so surprised after a few tastes, and even more shocked at the ginormous size of the scoops, that the first few licks of my cone were in silence. I just couldn't believe that this gem was lying quietly behind the hype of its neighbor, Bi-Rite.  

A must-try ice cream place. (one without lines and crowds)
author: Baviera K.

description: My friend said he loved this place, so we went for ice cream.  I ordered a mint chip milkshake and was really underwhelmed.  The ice cream tasted a bit like water and the only flavors came from eating the mint chips.  I think they said their ice cream was "organic" or "vegan".......whatever that means.  In the end, there's no reason for me to return as I've pretty much had better ice cream everywhere else.
author: Shaun W.

description: The Mexican Cajeta (dulce de leche) is my favorite ice cream in all of San Francisco, must try. Personally I think it's even more nuanced and delicious than Bi Rite's salted caramel and the Breakfast ice cream from Humphry Slocombe. Definitely give it a taste. I love it.
author: Erin P.

description:
I'm a bad child. :)

I tried samples of their ice cream...saffon, dry cherry and fig.  Fig was totally odd, overpowering and delicious.  Although it reminded me of a cabernet wine ice cream... heady.  Omnomnom

I ended up getting their 99 cent cone special on froyo... they had a vanilla and a blueberry pomegranate...yep, I did the swirl.  The blueberry-pom was tart, icy and delicious..and the vanilla was soothing.  

Plus: this place has samples of vanilla bean to give away.  And they have a reasonable price on their dried vanilla bean too....and saffon.  

Prices are reasonable and they are generous in portion!
author: Fannie S.

description: This place is less than a block from my house, so I stop by occasionally. Recently, they removed one of its most appealing assets--the benches out front. The ice cream is a strangely unappealing array of various manifestations of vanilla, made from a variety of vanilla beans from far-flung parts of the world. Certainly an honorable concept, as I adore vanilla! Bring on the Vanilla Revolution, by all means! But the ice cream is oddly bland and powdery, and they seem quite stingy about it. They used to have 99¢ tiny frozen yogurt cups from the soft-serve machine, also, but then they didn't, and now they do again. I wish they'd make up their mind. I think it's owned by the enigmatic vanilla bean importers across Valencia Street. The worst thing is the people who work there. They seem weirdly comatose, and act like they've never eaten ice cream. Ever. Not even on the planet they're from. They give one the impression that they are a cult. They are invariably robotic. The portions are disappointing. A sign says you can get free sprinkles, but this isn't a normal ice cream shop that enthusiastically dips your cup or cone into a big bowl of sprinkles. Instead, they use a teaspoon to arrange about a thimbleful of stale, introverted sprinkles sparsely on your ice cream, just enough to make you wish you went to a REAL ice cream shop WHERE THEY KNOW WHAT THEY'RE DOING. I have often wondered if this place is just a front for a cocaine-smuggling operation, or maybe the local Peruvian mafia. Or worse, not. I think I'd feel less irritated if it was a front for something, because everything from the window display to the decor to the servers to the politically-correct non-disposable tasting spoons is so dry and metallic and personality-less.  It kind of reminds me of what used to pass as "health food" in Paris--glum restaurants serving eensy portions of brown rice topped with irritable vegetables, the only vegetables in France that had the misfortune to end up as bad French cuisine. Anyway, do yourself a favor and go over to Mitchell's instead, and buy yourself an ice cream with a soul.
author: Caryn L.

description:
Went here for a little sweet fix yesterday on a glorious day. Wanted something small and healthy and opted for strawberry lemon sorbet. Yum! Just the right amount of sweetness but fully tart too-- can't stand lemon desserts unless they have the tang. 

I love how you can get a teeny kid's scoop for $2 and pay with a credit card. The girl at the counter was patient and friendly.
author: Jessica B.

description:
What I love first about this place is that the employees wear a net and hat .... why?? because this way, hair doesn't fall into the ice cream (other restaurants, cafes and ice cream shops) refer to Xanath !! these folks know about cleanliness..
Secondly, I love that they use really great ingredients... Also, the employees are always nice and friendly...
So far , most flavors have tasted really good. The only downfall, they don't give you a very big scoop for what you pay.... I just think it's a bit pricey...  However, I will attest to the fact their Mint Chip is super delightful............ and they don't use GREEN food coloring... Also, the Espresso/Coffee flavors are yummy... good coffee taste without the bitterness .... This place is definitely worth a try once.... and if you can afford, it's definitely worth a few times.......
author: Franco L.

description:
I LOVE YOU XANATH!

No one was excited to visit you because we just had awesome honey lavender and earl grey ice cream from your competitor, but you outdid them in my mind. You have bigger scoops, a shorter line, a restoom, a water fountain, a cheaper price, a nicer staff. You know the difference between Tahitian vanilla, Mexican vanilla, and French vanilla. You are the underdog of gourmet ice cream places and you are probably the only place that makes fig ice cream. I was torn because I wanted to get the saffron, but the fig just got me. It just hit me in the heart and you won me over just like that.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Why am I a fan?

1) No overhyped oversized line down the block (ahem birite)
2) No elderflower and gizzard combos (I'm looking at you Humphrey)
3) Just creamy unpretentious yet delicious ice cream: coffee and Dutch chocolate. Yum!
4) Cheap!

The decor isn't going to win any design awards but who cares? I just want a scoop of ice cream.

Con: only sugar cones (that don't taste great), no waffle cones
author: Priscilla T.

description: Nice that they have a child's scoop for $1.99 - a very good value - and you don't have to be a child to order it! I had a child's size scoop of the strawberry lemon vegan sorbet in a bowl- very light, refreshing and tasty on a hot summer day. My daughter had a cookies and cream child's size scoop on a sugar cone, which was excellent. I also appreciated the compost-able spoons and bowls. We will definitely come back again!
author: Susan L.

description:
saffron ginger and tahitian vanilla coconut = YUM

line can be long, but probably nothing compared to bi-rite or humphry on a sunny day
author: Long C.

description:
I love ice cream, it's sweet, cold, refreshing and creamy. I'm always interested in trying new places and new flavors. Xanath Ice Cream gets 5 stars in my book.

I tried two flavors before making my final decision. It was between the Saffron Ginger and the Madagascar Vanilla. They were both tasty enough to make me swoon, but the Saffron Ginger won based on the incredibly unique taste and it went well with the dinner I had at Dosa down the street.

I can't wait to come back to this place to try out again. I may even go for a double scoop next time. :)
author: Rebekah T.

description:
50 cents for a frozen yogurt cone? It must have been a really special Sunday!

I got a swirl of vanilla with the pomegranate blueberry flavor. Hella good. Props to this shop.
author: Melanie P.

description: a sunny saturday...odd name...no lines, and a whole lot of vanilla beans and saffron for sale...here for an ice cream scoop...$two.ninety-nine even...taking a purple huckleberry scoop on standard cone...quite good...good indeed...the friend taking the saffron ginger....good enough that he recommended it to a random ice cream browsing stranger...also mention soft serve only ninety-nine cents!
author: Hen A.

description:
Saffron ginger ice cream.  Get it. 

My friend Elliott tried a few samples (provided willingly by the super nice woman working behind the counter).  As I ate away at my scoop of saffron ginger ice cream, Elliott turned to the woman and said, "you know what? My friend and I have known each other forever.* I should have just trusted and ordered the saffron ginger."  It's true.  

My scoop was the perfect afternoon treat while strolling through the mission.  A delightful balance of flavors - the perfect amount of ginger.  

*Our moms were in the same lamaze class so when we say "forever", we really mean it.
author: Emily J.

description:
The vials of vanilla bean on display intrigued me to try this ice cream shop (plus I didn't want to wait in Bi-Rite's long line). The day I went, Xanath had a modest line that moved at a good pace, thanks to their friendly and efficient staff.

Ambiance was clean and bright, I like. 

Ginger saffron, is my favorite (so far). It has a nice kick, creamy, and made from Strauss Family organic milk.

They specialize in vanilla bean and saffron, which you can buy on its own, so if you like those flavors, this is the shop to try. In addition to ice cream, they have fruity sorbets, and fro-yo. 

Check out the parklet next door ~ it has a triceratops topiary.
author: Cathy K.

description:
3 stars for texture
4 stars for taste
4 stars for service

Organic! 

Service was great; they give samples and might I say, they're pretty generous samples. It's also really laid back in there but the only thing I didn't like was how small the place was and the placement of the ice cream. There was a stanchion for the line to form beside one of the glass cases, but what if you want something from the other glass case? It's awkward to push people aside or walk out of the stanchion to the other side--also not that efficient or organized.

I tried the saffron ice cream and the fig ice cream. The saffron was the one that originally drew me into the store because I haven't seen a lot of places that served it. The saffron was just the right amount of flavor for me. Herbs like saffron are usually very easily overpowering, but one scoop of this was just enough--I don't think I could handle more of that! The back of my throat gets really hot near the end. However, I must stress that it was good! Really good! (:

The fig was also a delightful surprise as it wasn't too full of fig flavor, but just enough--also had some fig seeds; mmm... Also, the saffron and the fig are a good combination if you're looking for a couple of complementary flavors. 
****
The only bad thing about this one was that it was super melty and soft.. which I hate... It might've been that they're storage wasn't cold enough. I ended up having to chomp it down hella fast so it wouldn't turn into ice cream soup.. blech!


The pricing was decent. My small cup or "one scoop" was $2.99. It says you can get 1-2 flavors, and as I got the saffron and fig, I expected it to be a half scoop of fig and a half scoop of saffron.. that wasn't the case! The girl gave me some pretty full scoops of each which I technically would've had to pay $4.95~ for (the "two scoop" cup). 

I love the unique flavors--but might I add, there are 3 different vanillas.. I don't think that's necessary...


I heard that there are a few other good ice cream places on Valencia with pretty unique flavors as well such as Mitchell's and Bi-Rite.. but those lines were way too long -____- I'm not complaining though. There was no line at Xanath's and it was satisfying!
author: Elaine T.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream place in the Mission thus far, and oddly enough, I have yet to step through the door. It's a funny story.

Ok, so post-uh, 'evening activities', I usually end up talking about food, and the topic dujour was this awesome strawberry milkshake I had had over in the East Bay this afternoon. And like most men, the bf was like "omg. that sounds so f*ing good right now, I want one" so he checked the clock, noticed that it was 10:45pm and got a thoughtful look on his face like he was remembering a certain ice cream shop down the street being open late. So he verified his hunch, and went to go get some creamy treats. Less than 10 minutes later he was back with a strawberry milkshake for him and a scoop of  vanilla for me. In my own defense I am a Pepsi addict and had originally intended to make a float out of it, but it was just too damn yummy to defile with soda. Plus, the consistency and texture was divine.

As for the shake, the bf was like, taste this, it tastes...... interesting. So I did, and I was like, omg, it tastes like.......... strawberry. And not some wimpy strawberry flavor. This was like a punch in the face of fresh strawberries and cream. I don't know if any of you out there in Yelp land have ever made ice cream (I've worked in several places that make it from scratch, so I consider myself a connoisseur of ice cream), but there is a significant difference in flavor between ice cream straight out of the machine, and that same exact ice cream after it has set up to a scoopable consistency in the freezer. This was like putting a straw in the churn and sucking out the freshest essence of strawberry icecreamyness. In a word, awesome.

Now, I've yet to hit up Mitchell's or Bi-Rite, but as far as I'm concerned, Xanath tops Humprey, hands down.
author: Amanda S.

description:
There are many reasons why BiRite trumps Xanath but the one that matters to me the most is that BiRite will always have at least one vegan option available.

Sorry Xanath, but stars are being docked for not updating your menu board.  If you don't have vegan options that night then take them off the board so people don't wait in line to find out you have nothing to offer them.

Meh.
author: Jen I.

description:
The "just-made" saffron ginger flavor here is the way to go.

Note that it has to be "just made"  - for that decadent creamy custard-like consistency,

Things that don't "go" very well with me at Xanath is the name. Xanath  sounds like an anti-depressant. How are kids or well people like me supposed to get excited about ice-cream -  if we can't even pronounce the name? I'm also not a huge fan of their strange sterile random window displays with obscure big bottles of vanilla and scattered saffron signs. Bizarre. And I think their flavors could use some oomph and variation. One or two of them just seemed off. Too sweet. Too strong. Too subtle.

But unlike Bi-Rite - Xanath never has a crazy wait. Their staff are patient and encourage you to sample as many flavors as you like. It's well lit and there's a bench outside for you to sit and enjoy your ice-cream.

And the big takeaway is that their child size serving of Xanath saffron ginger, with a sugar cone on top is a fairly cheap, but absolutely killer way to end a Sunday night.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Why all the love for Bi-rite and not this place?? Having had both, I think Xanath is much better, plus without all the hype and line. The flavors are  interesting and taste really fresh. I got mango and saffron ginger and it was some of the best ice cream I've ever had. Such wow. Much creamy yumness.
author: Sheera G.

description:
I've walked into Xanath many times looking for vegan ice cream (mainly 2011 to 2012), with no luck.  Or maybe they had some sorbets, but nothing special?

Then one day, I saw they had TRIED to make a vegan creamy style, perhaps made with soy or rice milk or almond milk.  But the vegan "ice cream" looked more like chipped paint, very dubious it was!  I was appalled that whomever in charge would even put something like that out there.  I mean, hey ... that's fine if your cooking experiment failed, but don't put it out there for the customers.  Yikes.   (I did buy it just to be sure, and yes, it was terrible.)

I have checked back in occasionally, and thankfully they didn't have the Paint Chip Fiasco anymore, but no other creamy vegan options either.   I haven't checked back in during the past few months; maybe it's time for another look!  

Meanwhile I've been enjoying the vegan sorbets (which somehow are creamy) and the vegan soy, hazelnut, and chocolate options at La Copa Coca (nearby at Capp and 22nd).
author: Rachel D.

description:
Maybe it's just because I went to Bi-rite, Ice Cream Bar, and Scream in the same 24 hours I went to Xanath (I don't want to talk about it. It was a rough day.) Regardless, I wasn't super impressed.

Yes, I read all the signs about organic, magic ingredients... but the ice cream just tasted less creamy and lighter than other places, and obviously, I wasn't dieting on this particular day. I had the banana with chocolate chunks in it, but the chocolate didn't melt quickly, like ice cream chocolate chunks typically do. I had to eat the ice cream and hold the chips in my cheek, anxiously waiting for them to melt. It wasn't bad, but on this self-proclaimed, "I will eat nothing but ice cream" day, I was hoping for something more intense, texture and flavor-wise.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I really really like this ice cream place. Here's why:

* Their ice cream is awesome. It's not too sweet so you can actually taste the flavors. It also (to me) strikes the perfect spot between being not too rich and not tasting like skim milk. I have tried many of their flavors, and all are great.
* All organic! Strauss! Local ingredients rule.
* Community engagement. They hire a lot of local teens -- I think they have a connection to Mission HS.
* No hipster pretentious bullshit.

Highly recommend -- I much prefer their ice cream over Bi-Rite or Humphrey-Slowhatever.
author: Geoff R.

description:
I think another reviewer said it best - San Francisco has destination ice cream shops. With Mitchell's, Bi-rite, Humohrey Slocombe, and Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous in walking distance from my digs, I've never stopped into Xanath. But as the saying goes, it was hot and I was hungry.

I tried a single scoop with a mix of chocolate chip mint and red walnut chocolate. It was really good, in the way that some ice cream is better than others, but not in the way that destination ice cream makes you want to come back soon.

Will I be back?  Time will tell.
author: Ivan L.

description: Soooo good. Kind of a random place in the outer mission with some amazing ice cream--just really rich and creamy. Love the variety of vanilla flavors (made from vanilla beans!) and the saffron and saffron ginger (ZOMG to die for). Also love the compostable cups and spoons. Check it out--you won't regret it!
author: Susan D.

description: My favorite ice cream place in the Bay Area. It is what all ice cream should be. My favorite flavors (some are seasonal) are the Huckleberry, Saffron Ginger, Banana Chocolate Chip, Fig, and Pumpkin. Every time I have a guest in town I make sure to bring them here. And pretty much every time I am on Valencia, I make sure to stop in a get a small scoop. Amazing.
author: Jen A.

description:
*Disclaimer: My auntie's taste buds are all jacked up (she just compared Garcon's food to Olive Garden) and my brother is super sarcastic.

Hipster ice cream? Hardly. Xanath Ice Cream needs to work a little on their parlor. It's like they didn't put any effort into the decor of their shop. If their ice cream spoke for itself and was hotdiggitydog, I wouldn't mind. It would be that hole in the wall in the Mission that was worth the drive/walk/wait. But there was no wait. Nor was there a shortage of parking (I got a space directly in front). Getting my ice cream from Xanath was effortless. Choosing a good flavor was the hard part.

I tasted at least three flavors of ice cream before finding one I actually liked. Pumpkin ~ bleh. Fig ~ too sweet. Chocolate ~ gross. Huckleberry... It's good!!! Not as good as Mitchell's Ube but it did hit the spot and it was different. I've been on a Huckleberry kick since I had Huckleberry cheesecake at Michael Mina. Xanath Ice Cream isn't a substitute for one hundred dollar dessert but you do get what you pay for. I was happy with my ice cream but my relatives weren't. They came with the expectations of Mitchell's.

My *auntie pretty much blasted Xanath for having terrible Tahitian Vanilla Coconut and my *brother equated the Dutch Chocolate to Safeway Select. I'll let this slide. I am a strong believer of their Huckleberry.

Back to the decor and shop. Xanath is a little all over the map. They've got ice cream, organic ice cream and frozen yogurt. I'd prefer them to be a little more focused. They have three large benches and one baby bench available for seating. It's like there was no thought put into the furniture placement. The baby bench is kind of squeezed in the middle. As for the name? No one can pronounce it. Therefore they printed up pronunciations and taped them up to the glass. It looked stupid and cheap. I'd recommend them incorporating it into their logo. 

It's not too late Xanath. You can still catch up to the veterans. Good luck!
author: Rachel A.

description:
We needed something sweet and palate cleansing after eating Indian food and Xanath crossed our paths on our way home so it was meant to be! They had quite a few flavors to choose from (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y1CtMGY68B5ZJeH82ok8HA?select=iYDLDZVWtYNLn05quzhQsw) which is always nice...not to mention they had eye-catching ones like Tahitian vanilla and saffron ginger. The prices were amazing as well (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y1CtMGY68B5ZJeH82ok8HA?select=OI4wOwVIIP7-jTvR2La-dA) ...$2.99 for 1 scoop and $3.99 for 2 pretty big scoops! 

I liked how the samples were given on metal spoons and that they used biodegradable utensils/bowls like Bi Rite does. We decided on the orange pomegranate sorbet and blueberry ice cream to share. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/y1CtMGY68B5ZJeH82ok8HA?select=n0xZEJkcYlspa0ynCRJX-w) The sorbet melted WAY too fast and was too icy...it felt more like a slush but it did have great fresh squeezed orange flavor. The blueberry one was too sweet and didn't taste like blueberries whatsoever...what a lie! At least the consistency was better. The benches to sit on right outside to people watch were pleasant though.

Mental note: I must come back to try their froyo! $1.99 for a small is dirt cheap!
author: Karen Y.

description: Friendly staff that allowed my friend and I to try several different flavors. The Ginger Saffron was incredible. INCREDIBLE!
author: Rich S.

description:
This is my "go-to" place on my day off to grab a $0.99 cone of fro-yo. It's simple, and it's great. 
PS... My profile picture show cases their banana split. 
PPS.... It was amazing.
author: Dimitrios P.

description: Nothing to rave about but equally nothing to dislike either. It was a tad bit too sweet but your regular ice cream.
author: Abhi S.

description: I don't care what everyone else says-- just try the saffron ginger ice cream. Delicious, organic ice cream, and hey, no lines around the block!  I like this place.
author: Joanne G.

description: Great alternative to the crazy line at Bi-Rite! The staff was very nice, letting me sample multiple flavors and even asking which flavor I wanted on top and which on bottom. I ended up with their (famous) vanilla bean and banana brown butter chocolate chip (yes that is a real and amazing flavor) with sprinkles and fresh whipped cream, it was wonderful and extremely affordable.
author: Erin P.

description: The saffron ice cream is wonderful! Lots of flavors of vanilla (they are right across from a vanilla wholesaler). I love the Dutch chocolate.
author: Heather R.

description: Saffron ginger had an unique and awesome taste. Liked the blueberry ice cream on cone was also really good.
author: Bharath R.

description:
It's no wonder so many hipsters are getting skinny fat!  Sure the ice cream is made for Straus Family Creamy which has grass-fed, sustainable, organic, local, well loved, well adjusted, college-educated cows but that cream is loaded with yummy organic fat!  Though the ice cream is great, the cones could use a little work as they look like they've been molded in a factory.  Maybe they can source the cones homemade from a Honduran micro-entrepreneur living in the Mission?

Huckleberry (Beyond Organic): Apparently "beyond organic" means picked from the wild.  Picked from the wild means that some unfortunate grizzly bear has fewer berry treats.  His bearish loss is my gain!  Way better than any blackberry or blueberry ice cream I've ever had.  Bonus points for offering such a rarely fresh flavor.

Dried Cherry: It did really taste like dried cherries from the Farmer's Market.  Unfortunately, I'm not a huge fan of dried cherries compared to fresh ones.  Think of raisin ice cream vs. grape ice cream or prune ice cream vs. plum ice cream.  Guess I'll just have to wait until cherries are back in season.
author: Adam B.

description:
Saffron ginger was amazing! My husband had the fig, and we were a little disappointed that it tasted like a fig newton instead of like a fresh fig. That's our bad though because they have a sign that says you can taste as many flavors as you want so you're happy with your purchase. :)

I'll be back very soon!
author: Margarita B.

description:
Holy crap this place was good. Like screw the calorie count, this is amazing and worth it. Generally, I only eat soft serve and stick to sugar free. Not a big fan of hard ice cream. Couldn't care less if the sugar is organic or not, its still freakin' sugar people and I try not to raise my levels too much.

All that said, this place was beyond worth it, and its softer than regular hard ice cream as well. She gave us samples in a metal spoon to try out first, I ordered mexican goat cajeta (its a mexican candy, kind of caramel flavored) and a banana choc chip. Really rich and creamy, their ice creams are made with organic sugar, definitely one of my fav places of all time, up there with gelato in Italy and Argentina. Can't wait to try the other interesting flavors, the flavors weren't as exciting in the store as their menu online, but I assume it changes so we will have to go back!

Note to Xanath: you should really make sugar free though. you would turn me into an every other day instead of once a week customer if you did!
author: Faina G.

description:
I've passed by this place a few times but finally stopped in with a few friends last week.  We were hesitant to buy anything but after seeing that they give out free sprinkles, we decided to try some.  My friends got coconut vanilla, chocolate and walnut. I got toffee.  We all agreed that the sprinkles were too hard. I don't know how that's possible but we regretted getting them.  I also didn't like my ice cream.  I only took a few bites of it.  I had my friends try it and they didn't like it either. I can't really describe why, but I wished I walked the few blocks to bi-rite instead. My three friends didn't complain about their flavors so maybe I was just unlucky. One scoop was around $3 so the prices are comparable to bi rite.  

There are two adult benches and one kiddy bench outside.  Indoor seating would be nice.

I really liked how they give out free vanilla beans, though!
author: Jenn C.

description:
Bi-Rite has nothing on this place. Toffee Caramel...twice as good as BR's salted caramel!

Oh, and organic fruits and ingredients don't hurt either.
author: J S.

description:
We were wandering around in the Mission, and somehow ended up with an ice cream cone from Xanath! 

Got a bit curious after seeing a tower of vanilla beans in the store window....Sampled a few flavors...Walked out with a free vanilla bean! Flavors were quite legit, and the roasted almond tasted like the cookie, which is much better than other almond flavors I've tasted! The regular cone tasted a bit stale though. They could definitely improve on that.  Interesting place that caught our attention....
author: Audrey L.

description:
Had this place bookmarked for a while, because hey, I like ice cream and vanilla, but good ol' Bi-Rite's just a few blocks away...

Upon eventually trying Xanath's ice cream, I can definitely see why it's in the meh rating range:  the texture just isn't smooth.  It's sort of grainy/powdery, and sometimes sticks to the back of your throat.
author: T C.

description:
It's kind of a hole in the wall joint, but don't let that stop you from going here. After the lackluster impression Ghirardelli's left on me, I wasn't expecting to be impressed with this no namer ice cream place, but wow, I was surprised!

PROS.
1. Free vanilla bean when you walk in! Seriously, those things are like $10 a pound at Safeway, and they give you a free Tahitian vanilla bean just for walking in! Haven't used it yet, so hopefully it's actually good, but still.

2. Many frozen treat options. Ice cream, vegan fro yo, regular fro yo, etc. 

3. One-of-a-kind flavors. I had the roasted almond (of course) and it was so good! They also had vegan almond fro yo (but not as tasty), vanilla coconut, blueberry pomegranate...and tons others. SO happy we came here.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Love the unique flavors they offer.

Am a fan of their saffron, mint chocolate chip, and Madagascar vanilla.
author: Lev E.

description: SF has a lot of organic ice cream shops, but Xanath is one of the top places.  They have a lot of unique flavors which are really tasty.  The people there are friendly (and patient while you sample practically every flavor they have).
author: Rose A.

description: The staff is pleasant and friendly. They offer huckleberry-flavored ice cream which was delicious! It's a small space so they are short on seating space.
author: Warren C.

description:
You know when you have to line up what seems like forever for great tasting ice-cream?  - Well welcome to Xanath - no ridiculous lines and the ice cream is all organic and great tasting.  There is not a huge selection, but what is there is really tasty, creamy and perfect for a hot day, probably great on a cold day too for that sugar fix late in the afternoon.  The girl who served me was also very helpful in assisting me with flavors which would go together (my husband wanted 2 scoops of course!).

I will be back, what a nice little find along Valencia St.
author: D B.

description:
I was here a few weeks ago with manfriend after eating dinner down the street.

Of course, I could tell right away that vanilla was their specialty. Unfortunately I do NOT like vanilla AT ALL. In anything. So I chose mint chocolate chip. 

It was artificially too sweet. I've had way way better.

I tried MF's vanilla and it was actually really good! I may even come back for that.
author: Sara P.

description: This place has delicious soft serve and way less lines than Bi-Rite. Staff are friendly and allow you to sample. When I went there was a 99 cent special on the organic frozen yogurt, but you have to pay in cash and get a cone not a cup. Frozen yogurt and sugar cone were delicious!!!
author: Robin L.

description: AMAZING ICE CREAM (Caramel Toffee) but MISERABLE SERVER.  Part of getting ice cream is the happy experience when you get it (like childhood duh) and the girl working couldnt have made it more obvious she hates her job.  Probably won't be returning with the abundance of other ice cream places in the Mission..shame since it was really good!
author: Raina D.

description: Tasty, and lots of fun options. Saffron Ginger was delicious, but I settled on the Pina Colada per the staffers suggestion. Glad I stopped in! No line, but smaller portion, yet still priced.
author: Bonny A.

description: The saffron ice cream is delicious, and you sometimes get a free vanilla bean with your order!
author: Ayo R.

description:
Simple & Clean, but the flavors weren't completely to die for. Still, I like the concept of the place, and the friendly, patient service.

Xanath emphasizes the vanilla bean with the artsy window displays of organic vanilla extract (a HUGE bottle) and other decorations related to vanilla. The store features three different flavors of vanilla: Mexican Vanilla, Tahitian Vanilla (with coconut), and plain & simple Vanilla. Other flavors included Raspberry, Espresso, and Saffron. Everything is organic here, down to the spoons and the cups, made of recycled corn materials.

I sampled a few flavors, and, although they were different from the usual, I wasn't overly impressed by them either. I went with a single scoop of espresso, which I thought was creamiest and had the right amount of flavor. The Orange Pomegranate Sugar Sherbet was very sweet, but more on the refreshing side due to the fruit flavors.

Prices ranged from $1.99 to $4.99; they feature 11 ice cream flavors, 2-3 froyo flavors (the "3rd" flavor is just the swirl), and a mix of interesting toppings for $0.50 each. They also serve milkshakes.

The sizes were reasonable albeit not a completely good deal: a single scoop of ice cream is $2.99. The single scoop fits into a petite ~4 oz. cup; upgrade to a double scoop for $3.99 and it's a 6-8 oz. cup. So, if you want more value for your money (and you're hungry for a heaping bit of ice cream), go with the double scoop. There was also a tiny 2 oz. cup for children.

Service was bright; the workers were patient enough to allow for me to try out five different flavors before I could decide. I felt bad since there was a line forming behind me (I think me and Lolia S. brought in the crowd....). Still, the workers continued to give me samples until I made my decision.

The place itself is a little small: only room enough for one park bench. Their bathroom is currently out of service, but of course, that's probably only temporary.

Neat little place, and hoping for a good future ahead for them.
author: Helene K.

description: yummy flavors, fun benches including a smaller one for kids! also sell vanilla beans or saffron if you need em.
author: K R.

description: Never had organic ice cream and I was blown away. After trying a couple of different flavors, I went with fig. Apparently there is no added sugar. It was naturally sweet and satisfying.
author: Michelle S.

description:
What the heck is this place thinking and what are all these high reviews?! The Mission is the land of Humphrey's Slocombe, Bombay Creamery, Mitchell's, and Bi-Rite, and this can't compete. Period. Their branding is off and their ice cream is off (they randomly call vanilla by it's scientific name and they have different kinds of vanillas without explaining what the difference is). You can't tell if they make the stuff in-house or just buy it. The yogurt flavored with agave (and I love agave) verges on inedible, though the price is right. $10 bucks says this place closes.

1 extra star for being kosher.
author: Andrew K.

description: Ignore the fact that "organic" is plastered everywhere and that the decor feels like a hospital with all the spices stored in brown bottles (and the intimidating"Xanath" name); the ice cream is cheaper than Humphrey Slocombe and arguably tastes better. Certainly, the flavors are both less sugary and more traditional, though if you're feeling adventurous you can also get the likes of green tea, pumpkin pie, and saffron.
author: Ceasar B.

description:
This is my back up ice cream place.  When I don't feel like waiting in the lines at Humphry Slocombe or Bi-Rite I go here.  It's not in the same league as the afore mentioned ice cream shops, but it suffices. 

My favorite flavor is the brown sugar banana.  It's nice to get a scoop of ice cream and then sit on the benches outside to people watch.

For those with an aversion to dairy, Xanath also makes some interesting sorbet flavors.
author: Lara O.

description:
This place has a pretty dingy kind of look, but don't let that fool you. They claim to have organic ice cream, and that's definitely the case. I had a scoop of mexican vanilla bean ice cream, and it had a pretty gritty texture, along with a taste sensation that was much like vanilla, although also a bit different. It's difficult to describe, which is why they let you taste! 

Compared to bi-rite, I liked the ice cream at bi-rite better, but the line there is so long that I wouldn't mind skipping out on bi-rite and coming here instead.
author: Alexander L.

description:
A love for all things sweet as well as an un-satiated craving for gulab jamun after some Indian food drove me to this lovely little spot. 

They are pretty simple and all natural. They boast flavors that I personally have not seen elsewhere. They offer 3 different sizes as well as a child's size. I highly recommend the Saffron flavor as it is incredibly reminiscent of that tasty Indian dessert. I also have tasted the Creamy Caramelized Apple, Caramel Toffee and the Brown Sugar Banana. There is also Ginger Saffron, Green Tea, Tahitian Vanilla Bean... aaaaand that's about all I can name off the top of my head. Oh! They do shakes too!

There are a few benches for seating and it is located pretty much in the middle of all those lovely Mission and Valencia foodie places. You can also pick up saffron spice and vanilla beans to take home. Check it out, you won't be sorry.
author: J. C.

description: I ordered the Red Walnut & Chocolate. Very good. The Red Walnut & Chocolate was so good that I ordered another scoop and Mango Sorbet 5 minutes later. I tasted a hint of liqueur (alcohol) in the Red Walnut & Chocolate. The Sorbet wasn't very sweet which I liked and it tasted very natural. The service is friendly. Extra points for the mini bench at the entrance.
author: N C.

description: Good ice cream, friendly staff, and you can sample as much as you want!!!
author: Betsy R.

description: Tasty soft serve, i would come here again. I like the waffle cone they provide, it is fresh and not very sweet. I notice that other ice cream places oftentimes make their waffle cones overly sweet which requires water to wash it down. I would recommend this place if you can find parking. Parking in the area can be challenging, but you do have the option to park in a lot which is only less than a block away.
author: Stefany L.

description:
Ok I'll have to admit, Bi-Rite was just too darn long of a wait so I came here. And it was really good! I had a big craving for ice cream ( when don't I?) that I was frantically roaming the city for some. And it was here that I found myself happy with a scoop of huckleberry ice cream in a cone. One scoop will do it. Yup, all those endorphins were released and I was a happy camper, with a huge smile, bearing all those pearly whites. 

Other flavors that were just equally awesome were: Saffron, Saffron-Ginger, Mexican Chocolate, Brown Sugar Banana, and Coconut. 

So boys and girls, the moral of the story is: if you can't go to your favorite ice creamy, then there's always one around the block (ok I lied, maybe 5 blocks) that will satisfy that craving.
author: Laurel P.

description: I'm usually a little put off when I see places that try too be too fancy, i.e. "all organic!" and "unique vanilla!". The flavors are truly intense here though - the ginger-spice cookie maybe unpleasantly so. The rest of the flavors were incredible though, and yes, the vanilla really is special. The service was excellent; usually I feel bad asking for samples, but the owner (I presume) insisted I try as much as I wanted, even all of them if I so wished. The prices are actually reasonable for the quality that you are getting, and jesus this is truly quality ice cream.
author: Cat N.

description:
Went here on a Friday night at 9:30...no wait..just some folks finishing up their ice cream in groups.  Def not what I'm used to for a joint with sucha strong yelp recommendation.  It was my first time here...I musta sampled 9 different flavors..i kept promising the lady it was the last flavor i wanted to sample...5 more broken promises followed.  I simply wasn't impressed by any of them.  Huckleberry was ok...the rest were meh. I kept trying more flavors bc I hoped one would impress me.  None did.  I settled on huckleberry because I had to choose one since I was already there.

Maybe the 2 star rating because I was bitter I had listened to my friend and forgone Bi-rite where I've never been disappointed to try this place for the first time.  Damn Damn Damn!  Not impressed.  Won't be back.
author: Eric H.

description:
A friend and I stopped by when we decided that Bi-rite was too far a walk for our mid-study break. We were greeted by two towering sculptures made out of vanilla beans, and three freezers full of interestingly flavored ice creams and (!!!) sorbets. 

Intrigued by the ginger saffron mango and the plain old saffron (plain old saffron!?), I asked for samples and was given a generous bite on a real spoon--yay for no plastic. Deciding to be gentle on my lactose weary stomach, I opted for fig sorbet, which was perfectly sweet, icy, and refreshing.

They have a great range of sizes to choose from (from children's all the way up to not-needing-to-eat-ever-again) and they offer you a free dried vanilla bean with your purchase. I took it and gnawed at it for a while... but I don't think you're supposed to do that--oops.
author: Allison S.

description: This was a stop on a Yapsie Pupcrawl and they had some very good and unusual flavors of ice cream and sorbet.  They are really well known for Safron and Vanilla (in fact they give you a Vanilla Bean to take with you) flavored ice creams.  They had a few different varieties of Vanilla and I can say after trying a few they are different.  They are very good about letting you try all they different flavors.  After trying a few I went with the Red Walnut and Chocolate which was wonderful.  The flavors are not as unusual as Humphrey Sloecome, but the lines weren't as long either and the ice cream was very good here.  It's was great to be able to eat some ice cream with our dog.  I'll definitely be back and I'll have to bring out of town guests here too to try all the good ice cream.
author: Scott L.

description: Wait! Saffron Ginger ice cream!? Yes. It's another go to flavor that's wows me every time. Parking can be tight so take the bus and walk.
author: Boy N.

description: With Humphry Slocombe, Bi-rite, and Mitchell's in the Mission, I can't believe I've found another ice cream contender. I saw Xanath when I was walking up Valencia and peaked inside. I was surprised to see that they served fig ice cream so I went with that. Fig was deliciously rich and creamy - a must try if you like figs! I also liked the huckleberry. When I got home I looked up Xanath and found out that they're known for their Mexican vanilla bean and saffron flavors so I'll try those next time!
author: Diana B.

description: I came by here after driving Mitchell's and Bi-rite and seeing the ridiculous lines.  I sampled the ginger saffron, but didn't care for it much. I ended up ordering the toffee ice cream.  I really like the creaminess of it, but It was a bit too sweet. One thing I didn't care for is that I ordered ice cream on a cone and shortly after receiving it it started to drip down the bottom of the cone.  The tip of the cone was slightly chipped off which made it drip as I was eating.  I felt like I had to rush to finish it or it would end up all over my hand!  At first I Thought it was just me, but my friend's also appeared to be dripping through.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Xanath is named after Princess Xanat of the Totonac people (in Mazatlan Valley on the Gulf Coast of Mexico) who were the first to cultivate vanilla. Legend has it that the princess wasn't allowed to marry her mortal lover. The two fled but were captured and beheaded. When their blood touched the ground, the vine of the tropical vanilla orchid grew (from Wikipedia).

This is a dual review for Xanath's ice cream and for their incredible store of vanilla beans. 

I needed vanilla beans for baking eclairs. Normal supermarkets/grocery stores/specialty food stores ask for an arm and a leg for a single vanilla bean so the Fiance did some research and up popped Xanath.

Xanath is a small, clean store that sells ice cream flavors like saffron, huckleberry, Mexican vanilla and fig as well as whole vanilla beans. We decided that some ice cream would help us decide After trying a few flavors, the Fiance and I decided on Saffron. It was so creamy and delicious with a nice little kick of saffron at the end of the bite. I also loved the Madagascar Vanilla (tastes like fresh vanilla bean ice cream) and the Banana Cream. 

Xanath also sells whole vanilla beans. These are known as chef quality because they're not pretty but they taste just the same as the pretty ones. They have two types: Tahitian vanilla beans and Planifolia (Madagascar) vanilla beans. I bought some Tahitian beans and they were fabulous. We also got a sample of a Madagascar bean (a single bean).
author: Christine P.

description: They will give you a really awesome vanilla bean, if you ask. I enjoyed all the vanilla selection and the the Tahitian Coconut Vanilla was yummy. Spill it on the front of your shirt as you walk down the street, yummy.
author: Laura F.

description:
On a rainy but warm night I stumbled upon Xanath. I thought hey why not. after asking what are the most popular flavors and going with someone that was not suggested... espresso (fighting the jetlag) I ate my ice cream. 

It wasn't bad. Not too sweet but not as much espresso flavor. I didn't feel guilty eating it. It was more than what I wanted to pay for ice cream but the portion was pretty big.
author: Tassamai s.

description: This is THE quintessential "secret" great ice cream in SF made with real saffron of the good kind.
author: Nena G.

description:
So the Boo & I happen to park in front of this place on our way to dinner and decided to check it out for dessert. The pleasant essence and array of vanilla pods tickle your senses. I started off with the strawberry lemon sorbet and the Boo had the caramel toffee, not bad. I also decided to try the .99 cent vanilla and pomegranate combo froyo cone. We were pleasantly satisfied. 

You also get a complimentary vanilla pod. I used mine to kick up a southern gooey cake recipe.
author: Ayyeng P.

description: Come here when it is super sunny (and by that I mean that the wind is not strong enough to knock over a tea cup poodle) and Bi-Rite is presumably snaked all the way up Dolores.  You will be rewarded with similar inflated prices, similar tasty frozen treats, and similar flavors that would shock a Midwestern farmer and his wife into a tizzy.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Best ice cream place in sf. They serve saffron and saffron ginger. They also sell real vanilla and saffron. Lots of people have died without seeing real vanilla. Any place that sells real saffron and vanilla should be a national monument.
author: Neeraj K.

description: I'm not sure if they make their own ice cream, since they've got Straus labeled on their buckets, but the ice cream is amazing and the customer service is even better.
author: Zachary K.

description: Good icecream.  Close to my apartment.  Yay!
author: Tasha D.

description:
Saffron ginger or not, it's not worth going here. 

I'd rather be in a Bi-Rite or Mitchell's line. 

P.S. Marissa secretly loves this place with her frequent visitors card even though she says that she won't be back.
author: Kenny L.

description: They have good huckleberry icecream but when i came, i found out it was seasonal.. very disappointed because i came to the store to buy a pint of it.  i will be coming back but only after calling in to see if they have my favorite ice cream...
author: Jen L.

description: Good ice cream. I've been here several times, and the best thing about Xanath is that there's never a line. It's not as good as Bi Rite or Mitchell's, but if you don't want to have to wait in line forever, Xanath is definitely an alternative!
author: Denise B.

description: It will be the best damn vanilla ice cream you will ever have.  Try the Mexican Vanilla; they crush up real beans, no extract, and it's dark, and good.
author: Joel G.

description: Hello!!! Saffron Ginger Ice Cream, need I say more?  Amazing organic ice creams!!!
author: Meli B.

description:
I stopped in a few times to grab a  $0.99 fro-yo cone. Didn't make me perk up the first time but I figured I'd try again. Tart-all-natural-organic dairy action going on but something just tasted a little funk to my taste buds. I've had way more delish natural/tart frozen yogurt.

As for the ice cream, it's good but not *that* good. Can't put a finger on it. "Too natural" of flavor selections? Not sweet enough? Not sure.
and if you crave some super indulgent flavor, this ain't it. No fudge swirl anything, no cookies, brownies, chunks of anything in the creamy goodness. Even the vanilla bean didn't woo. Flavors: think - apple, fig, vanilla bean, saffron...

On the last and final visit, we had a lactose-intolerant sweets-desiring one and she was let down by the sorbet. The soy ice creams listed on the menu board were MIA and according to the scooper, had been for quite some time. Lame. Take it off the menu.
All of us disappointed, we walked out sans ice cream and went elsewhere to satisfy our sugar-craving taste buds.
author: Alissa A.

description:
This review is (mostly) for the froyo.

I went to Xanath with my brother and tasted a couple of flavors (dry cherry and a goat somethingorother.) I found both of the flavors to be unremarkable, and there were definitely some ice crystals involved in one of them.

My brother got the 99cent special frozen yogurt.

My understanding of yogurt cultures is that they require a controlled environment that encourages controlled, known populations of cultures to grow.

This froyo tasted like something soured in an awful, pre-refrigeration, pre-awareness-of-bacteria kind of way. I spent the next couple of hours being unable to taste anything other than the acidic funk of the yogurt.

My brother agreed that it tasted funny, but he finished it anyway. "Too much trouble to find a garbage can," he said.

Should I raise the ratings by a star because they give out free vanilla beans? Nah.
author: Adriana V.

description: I am an ice cream fanatic, and I have to say that this was the worst ice cream experience of my life.  I went in a few weeks ago with my partner and my kid, we all ordered different flavors, and I ordered a sundae.  Every flavor tasted metallic and filmy.  I asked for caramel topping on my sundae, and I was given a teaspoon of topping over two scoops of ice cream.  I asked for more and was charged 50 cents for one more teaspoon.  Sundaes usually come with a good dollop of topping - this just didn't make sense to me, and, I realized I wanted to drown out the flavor of the metallic ice cream, but I couldn't with the insufficient amount of caramel.  All of our ice cream ended up in the garbage, and I was sad about the expense, as well as my taste buds.  With so much competition, I doubt this place will survive.
author: Arienne A.

description: The varieties of flavors are in abundance. Good portion sizes and not overly priced. I keep going back.
author: ReliSu P.

description:
We happened upon this place in San Francisco while I had a hankering for some ice cream...what a nice find! Interesting flavors, organic milk and oh so fresh!
Their was a bit of a wait, but it was well worth it. The saffron ice cream was delicious. I went with vanilla, a standard way to try new ice cream places, and I was so happy. The flavor was BIG and really got Vanilla down! My husband went for the caramel and it was oh soooo good. We also tasted the egg cream and saffron and they were nice. 
Definitely wishing there was one of these in Vegas.
author: Cory B.

description: This ice cream is incredible.  You won't find outrageous flavors like Humphrey Slocombe, but each of Xanath's offerings are simple and delicious.  You also won't find the insane lines like Bi-Rite!  For those reasons, I absolutely prefer Xanath to any other ice cream shop in SF.  I honestly have to go in every time I pass by or visit Dolores Park. I've had lots of their flavors, and while all good, the berry ones stick out in my mind.  Also, the red walnut chocolate is fantastic. The girls that work there are nice and generous with scoops and rainbow sprinkles, SCORE!
author: Jonathan M.

description: Even though it was 11pm and freezing, my friends and I stopped here for ice cream. Pretty good place, tried a few flavors... especially liked the tahitian vanilla & coconut, the banana was too strong to me. Good location for a late night stop although next time I'd prefer it to be a warm summer night instead.
author: Jessie M.

description:
We hit Xanath fourth in the Ice Cream Walk of the Damned.  We only tried the ice cream, no gelato or sorbets

Ice Cream Texture : 3/5.  Huckleberry and the other fruit flavors were really watery.  Saffron-ginger was much creamier.
Flavor Variety : 3/5.  Mostly fruit based
Customers : Nobody else when we got there
Strengths :  Saffron flavors, which were surprisingly better than the Bombay Ice Creamery saffron varieties.  2001-style whiter than white spaceship interior decor.
Cons: Weak on the butterfat
author: Dave S.

description:
Perfect on a warm day.  Tried the carmel toffee, very good.  
The customer service was good and attentive, perhaps a change since some of these prior reviews.  Will go again.
author: Jessica I.

description:
Generous portion for their frozen yogurt, $2.99 for a medium cup. More yogurt than you could get for the same price at a self-serve place. Plus, you get two free toppings with it.  Keep in mind, they have only about 10 to choose from.  The fact there's no void in the middle makes me happy. I've gotten that many times at other places.

When we went, the flavors were plain and chocolate. A got the swirl and he absolutely loved it. The plain was tart, very yogurt-y and the chocolate was a-ok. I found the frozen yogurt to be more icey than I'm used to, it's not creamy. I suppose this means it's more yogurt-y than other places. 

The ice cream flavors are quite descriptive; some vanilla, others include saffron. I sampled the saffron. It didn't taste like anything, to me of the sandpaper palate, but does have a nice, creamy consistency. When we came back next weekend, I got a small cup of strawberry ice cream. Yummy, creamy, and most importantly, it does not melt while you're eating it. Makes me happy =)

I'm coming back because of their generous servings. And their non-melty ice cream. I've never seen it busy, so near instant gratification. 3.5 stars rounded up.
author: Yan E.

description: Xanath Ice Cream is well due for a makeover. When there are many signs shouting the organic ingredients flown in from exotic locations and that everything is naturally colored, it starts to feel like they're lying. But it does look and taste like everything is what they claim it to be. There are almost too many delicious sounding flavors. I tried the huckleberry (I'm a big sucker for it) and saffron. I ended up going with the saffron. I really enjoy their ice cream's texture. It's not too creamy and not too runny. I'll be back.
author: Michael H.

description:
I am not a huge ice cream fan, but the ice cream here!!!! OMG, I love it!!! Even on an overstuffed tummy, I can still find space for some super delicious Xanath's...

they have some really neat flavors! I love the saffron one!

If you're in the neighborhood, I recommend trying out this place.
author: Kinjal S.

description: Delicious! And I love that they sell vanilla beans too.
author: Lauren K.

description: This is my fav ice cream place!! It has lots of interesting flavors, but never a line of more than one or two people in front of you. You can just walk in and get ice cream! They let you sample as many as you want, and use nice metal spoons to do it. I've tasted a few and liked them all, but only have bought two flavors. One was mango. It's so mango-y. Actually all their flavors are very strong. Some ice cream is kind of milky, but this has a nice strong flavor like gelato. They make their own ice cream and it's local and, i belive, organic. My FAV ice cream is saffron ginger. YUM. i could just eat that over and over. I had a scoop of saffron ginger and a scoop of mango in a sugar cone and almost passed out from the dairy/sugar (although their ice cream isn't super sweet) and it was worth it. Another time i had their affogato - a scoop of ginger saffron (you can get any flavor) ice cream with espresso. They went sooo well together!! I was just way too wired since i never drink espressos. This place is well priced and i think next time i'm just going to stop in and get a whole PINT of my fav flavor because i crave it constantly. Maybe bring it home so i can get a scoop of something else. Like the fig, when i tasted that it was good too. Anyway, def a great ice cream place and while i also enjoy humphry's, this is easier to get to and with no wait.
author: Merredith L.

description:
I've only been here once (today.)  I got a cone with a scoop of pumpkin ice cream, and it was fantastic. If there was a long line at Bi-Rite, I'd have no problem coming here instead.

Excellent service from the polite, young Chinese lady behind the counter.
author: Steve S.

description:
i didnt EVEN remember my last visit here.but let me tell you this (yea, YOU, attempting to hit this place up):

SAFFRON ICE CREAM IS WHAT THEY ARE FAMOUS FOR.nothing more, nothing less.

there.enough said. 
oh ya, i would say that XANATH is just an impromptu ice cream shop to go to.since it's the only ice cream shop along valencia st., i believe.
author: Marc K.

description: This is officially my favorite ice cream place in SF and I'm quite the connoisseur. Their ice cream is *really* rich and creamy and the flavor assortment is amazing...coconut, pumpkin, brown sugar banana chocolate chip, green tea, some serious variations of vanilla bean, intense chocolate options and so many more. They also have creamy tart frozen yogurt - yes, creamy, not watery. And, their ice-cream is organic!  Many thumbs up to this place. It could easily become an addiction!
author: John C.

description: The mexican vanilla is good but otherwise it's not too special.  Sometimes you just want some ice cream, and this place is definitely here and open pretty late.  But the soft serve is really bad - I keep giving it another chance and another chance and it's bland or just weird and off-tasting.  Bi-rite soft serve is soooo much better, IMHO.
author: M C.

description:
Good ice cream.  Unusual and fresh flavors.  Cute benches to sit on.
Try passionfruit or dutch chocolate
author: Brad R.

description: My favorite creamery in SF! Ice cream tastes really delicious, rich and natural (unlike for example "bi rite" which has just simple factory cheap taste). My favorites here are: fig, Madagascar vanilla, huckleberry, green tea, etc.
author: Iv S.

description: If you tire of waiting in line at Bi-Rite for yummy ice cream, walk down Valencia to Xanath and you will be happy you did. Organic ingredients, delicious and inventive flavors like fig, pomegranite, ginger,(as well as traditional ones), generous portions, good price and compostible containers. And much, much shorter lines.
author: peter R.

description: Great flavours, but the texture is on par with a 3 month old ice cream sandwich.
author: Andrew J.

description:
We've got ice cream galore all around the 'hood, so this one didn't quite measure up. Xanath had a good range of interesting offerings, but the ice cream was way too creamy and not flavorful enough for my taste. Though a nice little ice cream vendor is certainly better than the blighted and empty La Rondalla on the corner, so many thanks for un-grossing the block a bit.

I'd probably come back on a warm day if I didn't want to stray far from the casa, but I'm not in any great hurry.
author: Tara R.

description:
Came here for a quick ice cream after a few beers at Monk's Kettle. We had previous tried to go to Bi-Rite, but they were closed for renovations.

An interesting array of flavors, but I opted for something simple: Madagascar Vanilla. Pretty good! Next time, I want to try something more unique, like Saffron Ginger. :P
author: Kenny J.

description:
With artisanal ice cream shops on the up and up yet still somewhat rare, I am thrilled, thrilled! that Xanath is just a few short blocks over from my 'hood of Hayes Valley.

I have only tried one flavor, and one flavor is the only one I'll taste ever, and that is cardamom. It's exotic, and reminds me of the little cups of Arab coffee we used to take in Oman while sitting on the floor.

The peeps that work there are pretty cool, but they're not exactly the androgynous lovelies at Humphrey Slocombe that make me want to jump the counter and hump their designer denim clad leg. 

No matter. Who needs eye candy when you've got the sweet stuff right there melting in your hand?
author: Nicole G.

description:
You know how sometimes you walk into a party and the decor is off?


[The Xanath window filled with random items.]


You notice that too many people hosting the party have on green baseball caps?


[Huh? Xanath?]


 the guys all look lame-o. As you tongue-test them out--gotta be done--you find they taste kinda sweet, but nothin at all like a party in your mouth.


[Spoon samplin' flavors till almost full.]


AND THEN... 


[Cue music: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VnfVIBgymFM&feature=related

...Here's the new Xanath lyrics. Sing along peoples!


    You walked into the party like you were walking into my twat [what?]

    Her scoop strategically dipped below your lid:

    You're Vanilla AND Coconut!


Yes, in walks TAHITIAN VANILLA COCONUT.


Fine Fine All Mine.


The two sweet green-hat-wearin party hostesses--uh, ice cream servers--recommended Mexican Chocolate. But by then I had kissed that island flavah, and once you broke da mout--can't fix.


Sing us out peoples.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41zKVmk4z8Q

    I had one scoop in a small cup as I watched myself eat every drop

    And all the girls dreamed that they'd be your partner

   They'd be your partner, and...


    You're ice cream, you probably think this song's about ice cream

    You eat ice cream, I'll bet you think this song is about you

    Don't you? DON'T YOU? 


As far as I'm concerned Xanath is a 
Tahitian Vanilla Coconut Ice Cream Party In My Mouth Center

        and that sweet one is the only one for my lips.
author: Squinka C.

description: Amazing flavors with perfect sweetness!!! I tried the saffron ginger, hibiscus and huckleberry.  They also have Mexican vanilla bean, saffron, apple & cinnamon, dry cherry, Dutch chocolate, red walnut & chocolate, roasted almonds, pumpkin pie, Tahitian vanilla & coconut, spearmints, mango sorbet, lemon, mango, fig and many more!! YUMMY!!!
author: Karen L.

description:
Excellent frozen yogurt at a great price. I love the fact that they are reliable and always have chocolate and vanilla. The yogurt has tiny ice crystals that give it a unique and awesome texture. 

Prices are VERY reasonable and service was better the second time. The first time the person at the counter was really quiet and not very friendly.
author: Adam P.

description: Was walking to BiRite after dinner and instead decided to try Xanath.  Interesting flavors.
