I sampled the Mexican Vanilla Bean and ordered the Brown Sugar Banana with Chocolate Chips and the Tahitian Coconut.   Overall, decent treat for the eve, but not my favorite.  Can't describe it well, but all the ice creams had a frosty/icier consistency (BF agreed) vs creamy.  Somewhat similar to "freezer burn" texture.  Prefer the creaminess of BiRite for sure.  Worth a stop if it is convenient and you are looking for a treat, but not destination worthy.
author: Elle S.

description:
With the influx of locally made, handmade, small batch products in the city, seems to come ice cream. So, I  have taken it upon myself to try all the new places to see how these small local gourmet businesses are doing and see how their products compare to both each other and the more established places. This is quite a sacrifice on my part being lactose intolerant, but I suffer for my curiosity and dedication of supporting small local businesses, not to mention sweet creamy treats.

Xanath I found to be delightful. They use Organic Streus cream and interesting fresh tasting flavors. I did feel that the flavors could have been a bit stronger although I am sometimes a fan of the subtle ice cream flavor where you can actually taste the quality of the cream. I had Match green tea and coffee, Hubby had fig, and baby girl had chocolate. They were all light and refreshing in flavor. A little quick to melt, it was a race against time for us to eat our treats before we lost it to our elbows, so a little firmer freeze might be in order; but  all in all, the prices were reasonable. For two single scoops and a child scoop it was about $8, plus they gave us with our order two vanilla beans which in itself is worth $6, so it was quite a deal.

I want to go back to try their frozen yogurt. At $.99 for a 4oz serving I think it is worth the trip across the city.
author: Esa Y.

description: My friends and I stumbled upon this place a while back and decided to check it out. The have a good variety of flavors, but it doesn't compare to bi-rite. The ice cream is good, but too melty-soft for me. For the price, I would prefer to walk up a couple of blocks to bi-rite. Sorry!
author: Caroline C.

description: We walked into this place and received the WORST service EVER!  They were seriously rushing us out the door, giving us short answers and attitude.  Will NEVER stop by again.  Oh, and for the ice cream- I've had better!
author: Gaby G.

description:
xanath ice cream sells gelato, orgainic ice cream and froyo made by straus creamery. shop is very small and has very little seating.

froyo availiability:
-chocolate; flavored by agave? creamy and chooolate tasting. it has a unique taste i wasn't familiar with. was it agave?
-vanilla
-swirl

pricing: 4 oz/ .99 cents special, straus organic yogurt, 
straus orgainic ice cream, 1.99 per scoop. pints of organic ice cream (5.99)

frodrips
-within a minute after i parked, a friendly meter man came by to check on my car. seems every street in the mission had a meter reader.
-friendly fast service.
author: Victor G.

description: Their saffron ginger is smooth, creamy, and perfectly balanced in flavor..and Im hooked!! I felt like a fatty going all the way across town just to buy some ice cream, not to mention it was windy and cold yesterday, but seriously Xanath is that good. In fact, I'm happily digging into a pint of saffron ginger right now mmhmhmm! This place uses organic ingredients for all of their innovative flavors, and you can stock up at $5.99 a pint. So get off the Bi-rite bandwagon and give this place a shot.
author: Gabriella C.

description: This simple, straight forward Ice Cream Parlor may be the best one in the City, outdoing Bi-Rite, Joe's and Humphry Slocombe for reason's way beyond price, crowds or hip and slick reviews.  I was across the Street at some of the wonderful, unique stores when I noticed three Ice Cream Cones painted in the window and walked over to check it out.  I took a look at the flavors and colors, the sweet, polite young girl behind the counter, the metal spoons for tasting and the steady flow of smiling locals streaming in and out and I just had to try this place.  I taste their Peach and Cherry, and just had to buy a scoop of each in a cup for about half the price of Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe, and even tastier in my opinion.  If you get a craving for truly delicious, unusual Ice Creams, you must try this newcomer, you'll consider switching your allegiance.  Great Ice Cream.
author: Stu S.

description: One of my fav ice cream places in the city- especially the huckleberry ice cream!!
author: Romita J.

description:
Free vanilla beans!  Oh yes, you get a free vanilla bean when you walk in.  Is this too good to be true?  These things cost $2.50 a pop at Rainbow!  

Also the Mexican vanilla ice cream is pretty good. In case you didn't know, Mexico is where vanilla came from.
author: Monica L.

description:
There are plenty of good ice cream spots in the City, and the Mission specifically.  This spot will not disappoint.  
I find it hilarious that Humphry Slocombe has ten times the reviews that this place does.  Mission heads love their ice creams and they ooze the love for that place.  Well, give Xanath their props too!  The saffron ginger ice cream is one of the best that you will ever have.  Period.  End of discussion.
author: Cole M.

description:
The Mexican Vanilla was very good, and I'd come back just for this flavor and the big portions they give you! The child size ($1.99) is a big scoop. They pack it in there and more! I wasn't a huge fan of their Tahitian Coconutor sorbet (too syrupy), but if you find even one good flavor you like here, it's a great place to go because their servings are so generous.

A lady came in and raved about the fig-- I'll have to try that next time. 

If Bi-RIte is busy, come here for the Mexican Vanilla-- but if I were to go to the Mission just for ice cream, I'd head straight to Bi-Rite.
author: Saori E.

description: Saffron flavors are AWESOME!  the rest I tasted didn't taste as great.  Seemingly good prices on the vanilla extract, but on closer inspection....they add sugar.
author: Q L.

description: Great options, clean, friendly, but skip the pumpkin pie flavor - it just didn't taste right.
author: Vicki L.

description:
It's amazing how many people just don't get it. The Mexican vanilla ice cream is without a doubt the best vanilla ice cream I have ever had. The Tahitian Vanilla coconut is sublime. It's all organic and affordable which is a rare combination in gourmet San Francisco. This place is ahead of itself, vanilla is the new chocolate. Of course Bi-Rite is great and Mitchell's is an institution, but neither of those establishments' vanillas can hold vanilla scented candle to Xanath's. For a birthday party, go get a Kara's vanilla cupcake and put a scoop of Mexican vanilla ice cream on it and you'll never eat chocolate again.

Post script: just went back and gad the cocoa ice cream. I believe it is a single origin bean, I'm back on chocolate.

Let's review: 3 different vanillas , two luxurious chocolates, wild huckleberry, saffron-orange, a;; organic and affordable, and they're just getting started.  This is called passion; it's what the slow food movement is all about and it's what California is all about.

Here's an update: On Sunday I had the fig ice cream and it's beyond luscious. I had to have it with a side of Mexican vanilla because I can't seem to not have that too. I was very pleased to see that you can buy pint sized amounts, now I can serve it with the tart tartin that I make; I just can't decide whether to serve with fig or Mexican vanilla; I guess I need both.

PS I actually had a conversation with the Xanath geneticist who was there one late evening, he explained all the different (breeds?) of vanilla. 

I'm not allowed to go to LA without packing the Mexican vanilla in dry ice along with the lemon curd tart at Tartine.
author: Renee R.

description:
Saffron ice cream? Saffron (vegan) sorbet? YES!

It seems the whole new ice cream trend is to have unusual flavors in small, multi-flavor cups or cones (ie, Humphry Slocomb, Bi-Rite Creamery, etc) and this place does this new trend justice without the line that "oh my god SALTED CARAMEL!!!!" makes a few blocks over.

As with most new flavors, you should really try them before you get a whole scoop and realize it's just not your thing. On the other hand, how could lemon saffron not be?
author: Elena C.

description:
Oh Xanath!  I really want to love you because you're ice cream and organic, but you did not wow me at all  =(

Pros:
+  Friendly staff, patient with my wanting to taste things (I'm still so damn embarrassed to try more than 2 flavors!)
+  Generous scoops
+  You can have 2 flavors in the "1 scoop" size!

Cons:
-  Texture was all wrong for me.  Icy, not creamy and smooth like I need in an ice cream.
-  Had the Tahitian Vanilla with Coconut and Blueberry.  The flavors were too subtle for me.  I had to keep doing that open-and-close-mouth-tongue thing to taste the flavor.
-  Other than the different types of vanilla, the flavors were not adventurous.  
-  $3 for a scoop???  I guess that's what I get for living in the Bay.

Bottom Line:  I won't be coming back.  God I feel so evil for saying that about an ice cream place!!
author: Liezl C.

description: Bright and sunny day and in the mood for ice cream; walking through Valencia when a ha I spotted this small shop. What a pleasant surprise, I ordered their Mango flavor ice cream. Yum yum, sat down in one of their benches outside letting the world pass me by; enjoying life's guilty pleasures ice cream. For a minute I thought I was eating the real thing. Great natural flavor no added sugar, this is good stuff. Give it a try small store with organic flavors. Coming back for more, next time raspberry.
author: Jennifer M.

description: With all the great ice cream in the area, I can only give Xanath 3 stars.  Their vanillas - as advertised - are amazing, but some of the other flavors were only ok.  If you're a vanilla fan (like my wife), this is the place for you, but vanilla just isn't my favorite.  The woman who served us was very friendly, and I liked that there was some seating inside.  They had some interesting flavors that I would try again next time and it's definitely worth a try for people who love ice cream and have tried all the other places in the Mission.
author: Pilan C.

description:
Honestly, theres nothing special about the ice-cream,
I tried the different vanilla there, only liked one of them, yet its not the best Vanilla icecrem i ve tried
Anyway, the cashier was really nice and they  give out free vanilla bean, too.
And...they are organic if you care...
author: Christy Y.

description: Sampled the Tahitian vanilla-coconut - just okay, kind of tasted funny.  I asked which was the most popular flavor, and they said it was the toffee caramel.  I got a scoop, and I can see why people like it.  It was so yummy and buttery.
author: B. Y.

description:
I'm a newcomer to the Mission ice cream scene.  I was delighted to find that Xanath has several different flavors of vanilla ice cream, thereby validating my long-time opinion that "vanilla" is neither plain nor boring.  My ice cream was good, but not outstanding.  My friend got the fig sorbet and it was too sweet.  

We had a good time sitting on the bench (and the kiddy bench) outside Xanath.  It appears that a child drops his ice cream onto the sidewalk about every five minutes outside this place.  Amusing!
author: Margaret C.

description:
This ice-cream place was a nice pit stop while on a 3.5 mile stroll. I use the word stroll lightly! Ha. We were dying from thirst and the heat (in San Francisco? What in the world!?), and we needed something to cool us down!

I had the fig ice cream and my friends had the Mexican vanilla and the saffron. I liked the saffron though; it was more refreshing than my fig!

I'd recommend going to this place on a warm summer day/evening.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Lovely location, but stick to the ice cream.  

Pros: Conveniently located on Valencia, 99 cent yogurt!, open late, wonderful vanilla flavors, organically driven and bio-friendly, short lines

Cons: Not as creative as nearby luxury ice cream shops, agave-sweetened surprising

Located conveniently between the busy bustle of 16th and Valencia and the quieter 24th and Valencia, Xanath gets you in right as you're leaving the hoards...progressing to the quieter side of the Mission.  A nice cool reprieve in those rare hot days in San Francisco.

The vanilla ice cream is as good as they come.  But despite the many different variations here, the difference is subtle.  Creamy and satisfying.  The ice cream is just right, but the options are somewhat limited.  Better prices!

But here's the killer.  In a bad way.  Intrigued by the $0.99 froyo sweetened with agave, I was surprised by the imbalance of flavor.  The froyo was overpowered by the agave.  I tend to enjoy plain yogurt with its tart flavor, but the agave made the frozen yogurt...taste more...honey-like...metallic...uncreamlike  Hard to describe, but it was rather unpleasant.  And I am the one who loves crazy flavors like salt and pepper and olive oil.  

Short lines here might say something, but adding more creativity and rebalancing the flavors could make this place on par with other ice cream shops in the proximity.

The women behind the counter were very friendly.  But I almost felt like they weren't ice cream lovers as the people behind other counters at other shops.  Usually I expect the excitement in their eyes as they hand out samples, but it was only politeness and friendliness.

A few more improvements could make this place a killer ice cream stop!
author: Jenn N.

description: i don't know why i do this to myself.  oh, right, because i love ice cream.  i always ask for samples of their soft-serve yogurt/ice cream and it's always terrible.  the other ice cream comes in giant Straus canisters that you can buy smaller versions of at the grocery store.
author: Amy M.

description: Damn! Being attracted by the 99 cent organic frozen yogurt deal, a couple of friends and I stumbled in here today. I ordered a swirled chocolate and vanilla cone (delicious!) but I sure was disappointed to find my friend's huckleberry ice cream to be the obvious winner in comparison. Only $1.99 for a child's scoop (made for a LARGE child) and everything is organic and tasty. I will be back!
author: Amanda C.

description:
There is nothing like having some organic ice cream from Xanath on one of San Francisco's warm/hot days in The Mission. I usually go for the green tea which is not always offered, but my other standard  is the Huckleberry. Refreshing and perfect for that hot day. The last time I was there, I did go out of my comfort zone and did a double' gauncho of Dutch Chocolate and Mocha. If your in the chocolate mood, this is it!!!!!

Don't miss out ice cream lovers!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Granolia G.

description: As I write this review I am craving Xanath's saffron ice cream.  Damn, it's good.  Subtle and unique, Xanath is an understated ice cream shop and I appreciate humbleness; even in my ice cream.
author: Nick F.

description:
I can't call this place anything other than disappointing. It's right near where I live, but every time i've tried it I've walked away wishing I had either waited in line at Bi-ite or bought a pint from the corner store.

I gave it another go earlier this week, tasted two flavors (saffron ginger and toffee caramel) and wondered if I had lost my sense of taste--the flavors were barely perceptible--but then I went home and confirmed that I still had it. 

No, there aren't any lines, but there's a reason for it.
author: Casey P.

description:
Best thing about this place - all organic, all made from Straus dairy.  I sampled the:

1. Saffron Ginger 
2. Strawberry - my pick
3. Tahitian Vanilla Coconut - S.B's pick

After the initial taste, the strawberry is what hit the spot, but after eating it for a few minutes, I could no longer taste the strawberry and basically only taste sweet cream.  The balsamic strawberry at Bi-Rite is way superior - strawberry is enhanced by the balsamic and therefore comes through strongly for the entire cone.  S.B. straight up hated his pick - the vanilla coconut, I agreed that it tasted wack.  He ended up dumping the ice cream (said it was way too sweet) and just eating the cone.  I have to admit that the cone was fresh and crispy.

I don't think we'll be back.  Anytime you have to dump the ice cream, you gotta be kidding me!  I would have rated a 1, but added an extra star for using Straus exclusively.
author: Burrito M.

description:
The yogurt may not be as tart as one might like, but I really like the taste all the same. It's different. 
I got myself a double scoop of fig and saffron ice cream the other day - DAMN that's a sweet combo.
author: Corey V.

description:
The saffron-ginger ice cream is phenomenally good: rich, mellow, with just the right amount of spice.

The ladies behind the counter are friendly, enthusiastic, and generous with the samples.

The price is right.

The name is ... unfortunate. (Xanthan gum, anyone?)

But seriously, get the saffron-ginger and you'll go home happy.
author: Ethan R.

description:
I just had their plain vanilla ice cream.  It's their thing, no?

I wasn't very excited about the ice cream at all.  Check it out if you happen to be in the neighborhood, but don't go out of your way for it!
author: Carol L.

description: I always went to Xanath to get ice cream, not because they are good, because there are better places, just because there are no lines, and my last experience was really bad, the employee was really rude to me. The ice cream, not too good, too sweet and tastes more like fat, I got the banana with chocolate chip, couldn't taste any banana there. Was just terrible.
author: Erica A.

description:
Vanilla Ice Cream...cannot go wrong!

But since they specialize in Vanilla Beans and Saffron you would think their ice cream is on point? Not so much.

Got the Coconut Vanilla on a cone. ehhhh i've had better. It was icy because it was not freshly churned. 

Kids cone was like $2.50. good portions.

Plus for having take home vanilla pods as their "business card"

They should just stick to ice cream...froyo is not their thing even if it is organic
author: Tiffany T.

description: So good.  have had the saffron, ginger and tasted the various vanillas.  The flavors are somehow bright without squashing the delicious organic cream taste.  Person behind the counter is always super helpful and patient as I taste everything before I decide.  Highly recommend.
author: Otilia M.

description:
the madagascar vanilla ice cream keeps me coming back and fat.  they always give a complementary vanilla bean for cooking though i don't know what to do with it.

i do dread waiting in line on those hot days and busy weekends, people don't know what they want, they torture the poor employees with wanting to sample every gallon.  nevertheless, the shop girls are so cool with their smeared eyeliner and genuine smiles.
author: Noel J.

description:
First and foremost, the service was unbelievably friendly and nice.  Secondly, they were open decently late on a Sunday night.
Finally, combining the slightly tart vanilla fro-yo with the creamy and dreamy raspberry ice cream was simply the best idea of the night.  
I am not gonna lie . . .I am a Bi-Rite girl through and through.  That being said, this place is a bit cheaper, just as eco-conscious, and it has FRO-YO!!  It is worth checking out.
author: Lacy T.

description:
That?  Was not ice cream.

The ice cream is not creamy in any way, nor is it thick like soft serve.  The texture is that of melty frozen yogurt.  As for the taste, no matter how much you beat me with a hipster stick, I will never think that agave tastes like sugar.  I took two bites and threw mine away.

No thanks.  I'll stop by Bi-Rite and get a pint instead.
author: Courtney N.

description: Skip the restaurant dessert and treat yourself to a scoop in a waffle cone. Saffron-Ginger, Dry Cherry, and the stock vanilla are winners. Have a seat on their benches outside and watch the skinny jean dinner crowd scurry by.
author: J S.

description:
Friendly faces offering tastes of various flavors of your choosing.  I was particularly impressed with the mouth feel of the ice cream.  Not cloying and clean.  I've tried the blackberry (quite refreshing), Mexican Vanilla (more floral and light than your average vanilla) and the espresso (not too strong but satisfying).  I'm glad they are around becuase I would not want to have to wait in line at either Mitchell's or BiRite.

I will be back for more clean, refreshing flavors of ice cream here...
author: Joe O.

description:
Owner is the largest mexican vanilla bean importer on the west coast, was sick of seeing bad things done with the vanilla bean, and so opened an ice cream store, obviously.

Blackberry and saffron flavors were wonderful (and the only ones that I tried), but I heard that the mexican vanilla bean flavor is exquisite, so I'll be back to try that one.  Serving size was very generous and the staff behind the counter were all very friendly.  It made my Sunday Streets experience that much more magical!
author: carolyn c.

description:
Meh.  

Not the best of the city or the neighborhood by far.

The flavors are nice but the texture is waaaay off.  I've had a few things here and I don't think the ice cream is rich enough or smooth enough.  Also, it might not be the right temperature?  I've had some icy vanilla here before.  But today I tried Pumpkin Pie and it had actual chunks of ice in it.  I considered getting the Pumpkin Yogurt but it was pretty gross - taste before you buy.

The service was friendly and professional.
author: Linda L.

description: Unfortunately this ice cream shop is very close to other shops that I prefer. Even though the flavor of the ice cream is dense, the texture is a bit off.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I have to admit, I'm pretty happy with this place.  The ice cream here is great.  It is a little too creamy, though, so the amazing flavors don't stand out as much as they could, unless you get the real strong flavors, like the apple cinnamon, or the saffron ginger.  The mint chocolate chip was phenomenal, but again I think a little overly creamy.  

This place is also the Vanilla Mecca.  They have at least 5 different types of vanilla ice cream that I counted.  Mexican, Tahitian, and so forth.  All have their own unique taste, and each one really stands out on their own.  There is no such thing as plain vanilla at this place,and I really like that.  

This place is a great alternative to Mitchell's or Bi-Rite Creamery, both which are within walking distance.  My only real issue here was with the frozen yogurt, which honestly if you're going to this place, you probably don't want anyway.  I, however, in a moment of clarity, decided to go for the healthier option.   

And I regretted it.  

One thing about an organic ice cream place is that the ice cream is really fresh and tasty with ingredients you can really taste.  You ask for strawberry or apple cinnamon, and that's what you get.  The frozen yogurt, however, is also organic, which means that it isn't sweetened with sugar.  It is sweetened with all natural Agave, the stuff you buy at Trader Joe's.  

It DID NOT hit the frozen yogurt spot.  It tried.  It made a valiant effort, but alas, it was gross.  It didn't have the same sweetness you expect from frozen yogurt...unless you like hippie flavored frozen yogurt.  

I'm definitely a fan of this place, but I won't be getting the frozen yogurt again.  I am curious to see what their sundaes taste like though!
author: Adam E.

description:
I can't believe I was thinking ice cream on a SF "summer" evening was a good idea. Wool coat wearing, teeth chattering and hair matted by the light fog mist that was rolling down Valencia, we ducked into Xanath to see what all of this vanilla hype was about. 

Upon first glance, I was a bit confused as to who is the producer of the ice cream. Is it Strauss Creamery as the tubs of ice cream in the auxiliary freezer indicated or are they doing this in house? 

After tasting three different varieties of vanilla, my husband settled on the Mexican version, which had a very strong vanilla flavor packed in every bite. 

I opted for the fig, which was on the soft side, just like I like it and had a perfectly sweet fig flavor. 

In true SF fashion they use eco-friendly spoons and cups. My advice to you? Go in September or October when the summer weather really comes to town.
author: Lee H.

description:
Bravo for excellent re-use of this space (it used to be used as storage for all kinds of dusty old crap, right up into the windows).  Props to the ownership for seeing a need in the market along the Valencia Street Miracle Mile.  Too far from Bombay Creamery, and too far from Mitchell's.  Poof!  Enter Xanath.

I LOVE the fig ice cream.  Welcome to the hood!!  ;-)
author: Randy F.

description:
3.5-4 stars.

I tried my boyfriend's Tahitian Vanilla and it was really tasty. My saffron was milky cream, but light.

The ice cream here is definitely lighter and more refreshing. I liked their different flavors; it was also a plus that they're a tad bit cheaper than Bi-Rite.

Will definitely come back for more!
author: Angela H.

description: Organic ice cream in delicious and unusual flavors such as: wild huckleberry, brown sugar banana cream, saffron, saffron ginger, fig, dutch chocolate, apple pie, pumpkin pie, mexican vanilla bean, and caramel toffee?  Yes please!  Lovely sculptures made entirely of vanilla beans are displayed in the windows - very cool.  You can also get a free vanilla bean of your own at the counter.  They use Strauss creamery - very high quality.  Service was nice and they have a frequent buyer punch card, something I always love.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in the area.
author: Suzanne V.

description:
so close to bi-rite and humphry slocombe, no reason to come here.
sampled mexican vanilla, chocolate red walnut, fig, huckleberry, didn't really want any. plain texture.
fro yo still on special 99c
author: Rob C.

description: These people are performing community service.  99 cent Straus yogurt, can't get better than that!  Thank you!!!!
author: Vivian P.

description:
Perhaps a little later in life I will be able to settle and eat my favourite food - ice cream.  Iced cream, as one C. Montgomery Burns might say, is a singular food passion of mine and always a treat--in good time and those needing some cheering up.  I am in the epicenter of the San Francisco ice cream scene.  There is Bi-Rite and its flagship flavour salted caramel, down south is Mitchell's and it's exotic tropical fruit flavour profiles and on the south east edge of San Francisco's #Gourmet Ghetto is Humphry Slocombe in it's no apologies flavours like peanut butter curry, olive olive and balsamic vinegar and let's not forget Bombay Ice Creamery with it's subcontinent flavours--rose and the never forgettable cardamom.

Xanath, since it is within feet of my domain, had been a not-to-be resisted ice creamery or at least that is what I imagined.  I cycled by and did a quick u-turn.  I thought what magnificent adventures for me and my palette.  I tasted a few flavours and yes they were good; blueberry, chocolate, Mexican vanilla and strawberry.  Very nice people scooping up the ice cream.  The Mexican vanilla was the most distinct and quite nice with the Mexican vanilla bean presenting a solidly clean and subtle spice in each spoonful.  The strawberry was good but no more special than say prepackaged strawberry ice cream.  This ice creamery is still in the throes of opening and I do hope for combined and zesty flavors to come.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
I came, I ate, I wasn't that impressed.

I like ice cream. A LOT, like  eat it every day, have an ice creamer (two actually, one hand cranked, on electric). When I go out and buy ice cream I think ice cream that is very well made and usually in favours I don't make.

Xanath's pitch is the ice cream is organic and it use pure flavourings. That's it. I expect since the ice were single flavour smooth style that the flavours would be on display and each bite would develop the the notes of the flavour. What I got was ice cream that was ok but not much more. An hour later I couldn't remember the flavours I had. 

We were a group of 4 on a saturday night. We tried eight flavours and by far the sorbets were better than the ice creams but it was pretty average. The space is far cold in style. The servers very friendly. the space is bigger than bi-rite, about the size of maggie mudds with 1/2 the flavours of maggie mudd's but far less hipster additude than bi-rite or humphrey Slocums.
author: DeathandFood H.

description: The ice cream was pretty good...interesting flavors, but the service was just awful.  The girl looked incredibly bored and had the personality of a rock.  I would have given it more stars if it weren't for her...she was a real downer.
author: M C.

description:
What a pleasure to stumble upon this relatively new ice cream shop!  As a self-proclaimed ice cream connoisseur, it was great to find a new place with unusual flavors (and old favorites) done in a style that's light and refreshing in a way not found with other establishments' overly-cream-and-egg based (or worse, guar gum based (Mitchell's!)) delights.  Granted, I don't know what Xanath's recipe is, but it just tastes different somehow.  

So far I've tried the Dry Cherry (twice), the Fig and the Red Walnut Chocolate.  All really good in a subtly flavorful way.  As other reviews have mentioned, take advantage of the free samples to make sure you'll enjoy a whole scoop of something that's not familiar to you.  And keep an eye out for the bin of free vanilla bean samples next to the register, while supplies last.  Big thumbs-up to the store for using compostable spoons and to-go cups as well!!!
author: Tim D.

description: Good vanilla ice cream. Had a root beer float. It was tasty. Not super sugary the way I like it. The couple that runs it were super friendly and showed me how to make cookies with the free sample of vanilla. Will try the 99cent organic yogurt next time. They use real Strauss milk!
author: Beach L.

description: Forget all the other negative reviews! This place is delectable and scrumptious-dee-lee-umptious! Saffron and coffee toffee gave our tongues a whirl of a good time :D. i like bi-rite, don't get me wrong, but i would rather have xanath on a sunny day. Bi-rite is convenient and has already made a name for itself so as a result many flock to it. but xanath is a hidden gem. TRY IT!
author: Angeline L.

description: Both the fig and and the saffron ice cream here are excellent.  The service is always friendly and the prices are reasonable.  While the flavors aren't as edgy as Humphrey Slocombe, they are interesting and well done.
author: Peter H.

description:
Great ice cream, and what I really like is the fact that they'll let you try a taste WITHOUT a single-use, throwaway piece of plastic.  Yes, it's a real spoon, and - get this - they just have a place to put dirty ones, which they wash and reuse, just like a real restaurant.  Honestly friends, single-use disposable plastic makes us stupid.  Oh, and the ice cream and other stuff is really good.

A bonus - she handed us each a vanilla stick to stir our next cup of coffee with, and it was really interesting.  TRY THIS PLACE.
author: david p.

description: First time here. I found this place on "365 things to do in San Francisco" from a link on the livingsocial website. This place was supposed to have the "best VANILLA ice cream in San Francisco." I ordered the madagascar vanilla ice cream; it was good -- not GREAT; not as creamy as I usually like it, but some people don't like it as creamy as I do. Why I'm a fan of this place?? The employee behind the ice cream freezer was awesome. He gave me a free sample of real vanilla and gave me some tips of what to do with them. Service with a smile, and a free sample? YAY! I'm a fan =)
author: Maria C.

description: On a pretty chilly walk home from Beretta my girlfriend and I stopped here because I will eat ice cream in any weather. The vanilla bean towers drew me in, but the ice cream got me hooked. I got the brown sugar banana and the caramel toffee. Both were really good, but I think the caramel toffee was more to my liking. Overall, it doesn't really stand out above the ice cream giants of San Francisco, but it's still a tasty treat.
author: Jeremy J.

description: For sure some of the BEST Vanilla Ice Cream I have ever had. I had the Mexican Style Vanilla Ice Cream and it was great! The person who helped us out was also very knowledgable on the product and gave us a lot of tips on what to do with the Vanilla seeds it sales.  If you are in San Francisco, you have to make it a point to take the bart and exit 24th and Mission walk to Valencia and make a right!
author: Luis A.

description:
These are good times to be an ice cream fan. Not only has the froyo explosion continued unabated, but recent months has also seen the opening of the outstanding Humphry Slocombe and Three Twins. Go secret breakfast at the former and stormy night at the latter.

Xanath continues the trend. I had a taste of the much hyped mexican vanilla bean, as well as the intriguing orange pomegranate sorbet. Both were exceptional, and props for using real spoons instead of plastic for sampling.

Joining me out the door was an organic froyo blend of chocolate and vanilla, and at $2 for a small, the price was just right.

With friendly service, very reasonable prices and an extensive array of ice cream goodness, Xanath gets my four stars and a very warm welcome to the neighborhood.
author: Jason B.

description: Strawberry-Lemon sorbet was so good. The Mexican-Vanilla bean was grainy and good. And no long lines like brethren Bi-Rite and Mitchells. A lot of organic flavors. Small fro-yo for $0.99 seems like a steal.
author: Brian B.

description: Sure, Bi-Rite is around the corner and so is Yotopia if you're in the mood for tart froyo, but the thing I love best about Xanath is their pint sized Dutch Chocolate!  Yuuum!!  I pop in every so often to pick up a pre-packed pint to enjoy in the comforts of my own home.  It's about a dollar cheaper for their pre-packed pints than at Bi-Rite.  I go to Bi-Rite when I'm craving something other than classic chocolate.
author: Lynda N.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe in one direction, Bi-Rite Creamery in the other, Xanath looks like it has positioned itself to divide and conquer.  Now if only the ice cream lived up to those other joints.

I tasted the Mexican Vanilla Bean, and ordered the Espresso, both of which were very solid.  I'd say it tasted not-quite-Haagen-Dazs. Moreover, they just don't have the same high-quality creaminess, or interesting flavor twists of the two previously mentioned shops.

Caveat: They had a really wide array of fruit flavors... I'm just not a fruit ice cream kind of guy.  So if the fruit flavors turn out to be their specialty, well I guess that invalidates this entire review.
author: David K.

description: This is my newest favorite ice cream place. Fresh, delicious and cheap! Did I mention organic? Really, I love this place, though my friend thinks its a store front for drug/mafia because their decor is more 'hole in the wall-ish', but I think its just a grassroots kind of place and I love it.
author: eva s.

description: 1 extra point for having better Saffron Ginger ice cream than Bombay. Other than that, all their flavors (to me) are bland and not worth it. Go up to Dolores & 18th for Bi-Rite if you're already in that neighborhood.
author: Marissa H.

description: Xanath now has a larger variety of (interesting) flavors.  On my most recent visits, I had the wild huckleberry and saffron ginger ice cream, both of which were fantastic!
author: Grace W.

description: Obsessed with their organic frozen yogurt and free spinkles!  So nice to finally find decent frozen yogurt that doesn't taste like chemicals.  They also have great ice cream flavors.
author: Briana B.

description: It was interesting though. The Mexican Vanilla had a bite to it. I wasn't expecting that. It was OK as a sample treat but I won't order that ever again. I didn't have anything else at the store.
author: Sara A.

description: Two words: Mexican Vanilla. Buy it. You will be happy. The end.
author: Fancypants J.

description: I like it, they open quite late .. prices are affordable and they give you a lot more than other places!..ohhh...love it!!!!...taste is delicious.
author: Geena T.

description: Saffron Ginger is phenomenal. Tastes like real saffron and ginger. Fig was not bad (tasted like real fig and not slimey). Overall definitely worth stopping in for... as opposed to waiting for unimpressive Honey Lavender at Bi-Rite. Other clientele (normal in San Francisco but nowhere else) seemed to be annoying the woman working there, but she was nice enough to us but not enthusiastic overall.
author: Tom H.

description: Organic, local ice cream in delicious, unique flavors at reasonable prices in an unpretentious and friendly setting? Yes, please.  I am a new fan.  Can't wait to come back and try every flavor.  The fig was absolutely delicious.  And the Strauss Organic frozen yogurt is so yummy!  I love the simplicity of their offerings and the obvious love that goes into the making of this ice cream.  Yum!
author: Alli J.

description: After the first few delicious scoops last summer, the huckleberry flavor has become pretty grainy and slimy textured. Give it a test lick before you buy next time...
author: Vidya S.

description: I only had a single scoop of the infamous madagascar vanilla & oh man, it was so Good!!!   What a lovely delight!!!   Who wants to have an ice cream treat with me next?!!
author: Linda L.

description: Lovely, simple ice cream.  In a city full of excellent food, my time is too valuable to spend in line for an hour for ice cream (ahem, Bi-Rite).  Therefore, this slightly quirky place is perfect.  The flavors are unusual, the vanilla just right, the texture great, the prices reasonable.  If you're going to get in a snit about ice cream that isn't snooty enough, I don't think I like you very much. Life is too short.
author: Jude F.

description: Wow! The portions are huge! Artisan ice cream in Baskin Robbins sized servings, not bad. The texture is kind of more reminiscent of Gelato, but has a much creamier (must be fattier) mouth feel. The vanilla flavors we sampled were definitely really delicious; although I didn't particularly care for the ginger-saffron flavor (it could use more ginger and less saffron). It's also unclear why they are selling Strauss ice cream by the pint, but these oddities aside the ice cream is good, the flavors are different, and the prices are right. They are also currently handing out free vanilla beans so hurry on over and get a small, unless you really like ice cream, than go to town and get the medium, I think the large might cause immediate cardiac arrest so I can't recommend it at this time.
author: Alex D.

description: $3 single scoop, $4 double, organic sustainable creamy delicious real vanilla ice cream.  Would be 5 stars if they just had seats and a few more creative flava's.
author: Paul W.

description: Totally. Awesome. Ice Cream. And their imported vanilla is certified kosher. And it's amazing. Just. Get. Some. Now.
author: Aaron S.

description: I had the ginger saffron ice cream which was really gingery but not with the typical overly strong kick that you get when too much is thrown in. The store also sells vanilla beans and extract at good prices. The store fronts small but good for grabbing and going.
author: Terry H.

description: I've only stopped in here a few times for a 99cent Strauss froyo cone- perfect treat for a sunny afternoon. It's  a kind of funky place. Everytime I've been there it's the same froyo flavors- vanilla and blueberry-pomegranate, which makes for a nice swirl. The ice cream seems to have some interesting flavors as well, would be a good substitute when Bi-Rite line is too long.
author: Kristen R.

description: My friend and I came here for the first time today, after experiencing a less than satisfying lunch, and  Xanath saved the day.  We tried the Mexican vanilla and the chocolate walnut...both were delicious. Will definitely be back!
author: SL N.

description:
I stumbled upon this place the other day. I didn't even realize what they sold was organic -- it was yummy! The place is small, quaint, clean, and cute. Upon walking inside, the girl at the counter offered us a sample. I tried the fig flavor only to remember that I don't like figs. That was a nice walk down memory lane and a total waste of my sample tasting. Totally my fault for forgetting.

I figured I wouldn't be able to get another sample, but the girl (who looked like she was a young high school student) offered me another sample before I could finish contemplating asking for a different flavor. I tried the Meixcan Vanilla Bean. Bingo, we have a winner. I got a double scoop.

They don't have an uber-large selection, but it's sufficient because they have some standards (like toffee) and some exotic ones. There's enough variety.

For a tiny place, it's nice that they have a bathroom for patrons. I also was impressed with the hand sanitizer hanging from the wall. Gotta love a place that is hygenic. Oh, it's also nice that for such a small place, they take various credit cards. I wasn't expecting that.

I walked off happy with my ice cream. We were even offered free vanilla beans on our way out. 

I don't understand the reviews about the lack of customer service. The server we got was really sweet and thoughtful. Maybe they changed staff recently, but it really helped making the impromptu visit that much more pleasant. 

On a nice day, this place is a great pit stop. Go get yourself some ice cream, then head for a walk around the sunny Mission or take a stroll up to Dolores Park.
author: O K.

description: Update - 3/14: Added one star. Finally, I made good on the owner's promise to refund the overcharge from last year. On another day I will cash in my comped scoop, and we'll see where the rating goes.
author: Randy M.

description: Organic Huckleberry ice cream! Three different kinds of vanilla? Yum! Best ice cream in town, probably not, but certainly worth it during a post dinner Valencia St. stroll.
author: marc S.

description:
i wanted a bite of sweet after my meal at herbivore, and also to cool me down on that hot summer day.  xanath was a couple doors down, and hit the spot.  the place is clean, bright and airy.  i was drawn by the organic ice cream/fro-yo, and what enticed me even more was that agave is what sweetened their vanilla fro-yo.  it was delicious, and only $0.99 for 4oz.  

they gave me a vanilla bean to take home -- cute touch.
author: Sheri N.

description: Promising when it opened and liked the Fig and Madagascar, but hated the Tahitian. They need to improve the overall quality and experience with Bi-Rite, Murphy's and Mitchell's so closeby.
author: Peter H.

description: Xanath was pretty good, but by ice cream standards set by Three Twins, Mitchells and Birite, this isn't quite as good. They have more flavors that three twins or birite, but not the extremely off-the-wall type flavors of Birite. I sure did like my Madagascar Vanilla though, don't get me wrong. I love ice cream so i still walked away happy, just not blown away.
author: Bowen P.

description:
With so much incredible ice cream in its neighborhood, it takes a lot to stand out, and Xanath manages it with ease. It may not have the wide variety of fancy flavors that other places have, but it EXCELS at what it does.

Never before has there been an ice cream place that has compelled me to come back again and again for the ::vanilla::, but Xanath makes me wonder why you would bother making ice cream with anything else. I don't even want to try the other flavors there--a scoop each of Mexican and Madagascar vanilla does the trick for me!
author: Molly A.

description: Love the mint chip so yummy and refreshing, they also have a one dollar yogurt ice cream that's a pretty large serving ;)
author: Tiff W.

description: Despite the unique array of flavors, the taste of the ice cream here was too creamy and bland. When I order fig and apricot ice cream I expect a fruit-fiesta-o-flavors in my mouth. Both of these flavors tasted like the vanilla ice cream had *maybe* flirted between fig and apricot, but didn't end up getting to first base with either. It was disappointing, to say the least.
author: Tiff C.

description: Solid ice cream, but no WOW! I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS!  flavors.  Tried the vanilla, saffron, and chocolate.  All were excellent.  Maybe the best thing to say about the ice cream is it seemed to get better with each bite.  This is unusual as many ice creams fade with each bite.  Friendly service. Worth a visit. Heck, you can pick up some vanilla beans if your in the need.  Not many ice cream stores have that going for it.
author: p w.

description: Would give 3.5 if half stars were an option, since free vanilla beans are (were?) given out upon each visit -- a lovely touch.  The ice cream is pretty good too, not the best in the area, but a worthy addition, with room for improvement.
author: Alyssa B.

description: Recently new creameries are popping everywhere, it is in fashion i guess.. Well I have to tell you, there is not an ice cream shop I have not tried yet, I live off this stuff. But you know what, a fancy name does not guarantee outstanding quality, as we all know. The ice cream has like 50% fat content in it, it feels like eating a stick of flavoured butter. And the flavours are not so special - everything I tried tasted rather dull and ordinary. Sorry, not a keeper for me..
author: lulu d.

description: As I was tasting the flavors I was getting steadily disappointed, and embarrassed, because I had used the bathroom first and thus felt obligated to purchase something. Finally I found something great. The mango ice cream was delicious and mango fruit tasting. They give you GIANT portions so even though I got one scoop it was nearly the size of my fist and I could not finish it. There are lots of vanilla products you can purchase (although honestly, buy vanilla beans on ebay, much cheaper). The staff was friendly and the bathroom was clean.
author: Shizuka L.

description: I sampled saffron, fig, and another flavor that had coconut.  All three flavors were pretty good actually and I ended up getting a cone of the fig. I think they deserve 3.75 stars not quite four cos there is no dearth of good ice cream in this city. That being the case ratings encompass more than merely how good the ice cream is. The Xanath experience is lackluster, and I think Id be more likely to try something new the next time as opposed to go back there.
author: Vivek N.

description: I never thought the day would come when I'd rate an ice cream store below a 4 but I guess I thought ice cream was failproof. After frequenting the great ice cream stores of Frisco more than any religion, I thought for sure Xanath would keep me faithful. Maybe my expectations were too high but I wasn't wowed by any of the flavors. To be fair, I only had maybe 3 but all were dissapointments. The saffron tasted just like a version of vanilla. The Dutch chocolate was so bitter that it almost matched the bitterness of drip coffee. I couldn't even remember what the third flavor was but it also tasted like vanilla. I suppose if you're a vanilla fiend, you'll rate this place more than a 2. If you have tried any of the greats like Mitchell's and Bi-rite, you will be rating a 2 or below. *tear*
author: Gwen L.

description: Just ok... Humphry Slocombe is still the best in my book.
author: Lauren S.

description: Stubbles into this ice cream parlor on our way to the Indian ice cream down the block.  Tried the ginger saffron, the lemon-orange sorbet, but ultimately got the lemon-strawberry sorbet.  Let me just say YUMSSSS. My friend has the apple cinnamon and he was very very impress.  Wonderful blend without the cinnamon being too overwhelming.  Everyone knows that cinnamon can be taken only in the right amount.   Everything is organic and the price is a lot more moderate then the other ice cream parlor in the area.  The staff and owner of the store is very nice and personable.  Didnt rush us to order and be on our way, which is great because next time I am going to try all the flavor.
author: Winny L.

description: From the outside, it looks like an old school drugstore. Sterile atmosphere inside, but man, that red walnut chocolate ice cream is nice.
author: Maximillian M.

description: First off, what I love about this place is that it's CLEAN and the employees have to wear a hat or hairnet.. to me, other places fall short and are too dirty. .not this place.. clean clean .. now on to the product.. I have tried this place about 7 times now and all 7 times were wonderful................. we have tried various flavors and have loved each of them.. To me, this is good ice cream and you can taste the fact that they use great ingredients.. What's also great about this place, you won't see any of those old looking cardboard containers with old ice cream heaped on top of the new.... I think in this place's case, it's because they don't make a ton, but rather make just enough to sell and therefore, it keeps the quality up... I recommend this place if you want something fresh, organic and unique..
author: Susan L.

description: Interesting selection! Had the vanilla madagascar. Definitely will try more flavors.
author: Sumi Y.

description: Yes I love BiRite and Humphrey Slocombe.  Xanath may currently lack the (deserved) buzz of the others, but still gets a thumbs up.  Stumbled past it on Valencia after dinner, glad I popped in.  Owner appears to be a spice importer, spices which make their way into the ice cream.  The Vanilla ice cream is rich and decadent in its own right.  My favorite was the Saffron.
author: Tyler H.

description: Big ups for making me try several flavors before letting me buy something! That said, the texture was not quite right- a little icy- maybe not quite enough fat in the recipe? I'm going for ice cream, not ice milk, after all. Still, the friendly older guy made it OK.
author: Jonny A.

description:
As a frazzled, single mom of twins, I can't justify the time loss to write reviews.  But felt like making an exception for Xanath.  The name made me think it would not be somewhere I would want to take my kids, possibly uptight.  it's not at all.  The owner is incredibly friendly, and clearly takes a great deal of pride in his work.

The girls behind the counter were accommodating, letting us sample 5 flavors (with metal spoons yay!).  The owner brought my son napkins when he saw he needed some, he asked us what flavors we were having and when my son said fig, he explained it was organic and had no sugar just fig paste and he had mad it himself.  He pointed out the vanilla vine growing in the pot nearby  He is very enthusiastic about using organic products, agave or fruit sweeteners as well as sugar, all compostable spoons.  I hope he succeeds.

I noticed other reviews that didn't care for the texture of the ice cream, I thought it was perfect.  If ice cream is hard it freezes your taste buds and then you are unable to taste the flavors especially the vanilla and fruits.  It was truly wonderful.  A child's cone is $2 which is reasonable, especially when you compare it to the decapitated ninja turtle ice cream head they beg for from the ice cream man outside of school.

I can't wait to try more.
author: Adrienne S.

description:
my fiancee and i had lunch at Herbivore and he suggested getting an ice cream at the shop we'd passed as a reward for all of our walking that day.  that little shop was Xanath and O.M.G. best idea ever!  there were several standard flavors but also several really unique ones i'd never heard of before.  i tried the ginger saffron and fell in love!  i got a scoop and savored every spoonful!  bonus: free vanilla bean samples!  my FH had the chocolate chip mint.  at first, because he isn't really a sweets person, he didn't think he'd be able to finish it.  ummmm... let's just say that cup was empty the next time i looked up!

Xanath FTW!
author: Angie M.

description:
I've been cutting out sweets, so ice cream hasn't been something I've been allowing myself to eat. However,  when I walked past Xanath and saw that all their ice cream was organic, using locally produced milk, I just had to cheat and give it a try.
I sampled the saffron ginger which I thought was tasty, but ended up getting a nice size cup of organic frozen yogurt (vanilla and chocolate swirl) for 99 cents. Pretty hard to beat that price. I actually asked to see the list of ingredients and found them to be quite natural with no fillers, unlike most frozen yogurt. It had a little tang to it, tho I would have enjoyed even more "sourness". 
The free vanilla bean was a nice touch. In case you're wondering what to do with a vanilla bean besides sniff the delicious aroma, it can be chopped up and added to a little vodka to make your own vanilla extract. It's also delicious in homemade kahlua or split open and steeped in hot milk.
author: GoddessDi D.

description: i really liked the saffron ginger ice cream that i tried.  i also tried the lemon strawberry sorbet, which was good, but i only really tasted the strawberry.  i ended up getting a 99 cent froyo cone which was very tart.  the vanilla yogurt was good, but the pumpkin tart was a bit...interesting.  fiance got a child cup of red walnut chocolate.  the ice cream here is a great deal for a big portion.
author: Helen T.

description: To be situated where they are, at the epicenter of so many freaking amazing ice cream places, Xanath had to kick ass. My friend JT decided to try them recently, having been to Mitchells, Humphrey Slocombe and Birite 87 billion times each. We went, tried about 5 flavors, and none of them were particularly good. they were cloying, boring, and didn't do it for us. As well, they don't actually MAKE their own ice cream. They use a strauss ice cream base, and just flavor it, as opposed to the other ice cream places, that are all house made. fuck that. there's a *reason* there are lines at birite and humphrey slocombe. I won't be returning.
author: Photo D.

description: yummy!  i still love my coffee toffee from bi-rite, but the tahitian vanilla coconut here is not shabby at all.  kids cone for 1.99, which means i don't feel stuffed on ice cream, plus the store smells fab, like vanilla beans, AND we got a free vanilla bean to take home w/our cone!  no idea what to do w/my bean, but it smells nice.  i want to take my mom here next time she's in town!
author: Zoe L.

description: xanath is super cute and the $0.99 frozen yogurt cup special is just right.  not only is it sweetened with agave instead of white sugar, but the price is perfect for "this" economy.  woot.
author: Sandra T.

description: Great tasting ice cream. Pretty good service. Decent selection. Will certainly be back. Sure beats the wait at Bi Rite and Mitchel's.
author: Joe C.

description: I was looking for frozen yogurt near my new apt, and after reading the Yelp reviews, decided to come here. I was so pleased! Tiny, adorable, friendly shop, and tiny, adorable, friendly shopgirl. The ice cream selection is definitely more exciting than the fro-yo selection, but I was on a mission for fro-yo, dammit. The yogurt does NOT taste like Tasti D, Pinkberry, or (insert your favorite college-years low-cal frozen dairy dessert here), but that's great because it actually tastes like yogurt. Which has been frozen. I got a cone of vanilla (99 cents) with organic walnuts (50 cents). Sprinkles and cinnamon are free. You can get a small cup for $1.99 or a medium for $2.99, but my cone was the perfect serving size for a snack or light dessert. Got my punch card and will be returning! My only suggestions would be some indoor seating (it was windy outside on the bench!) and a wider selection of toppings (I'm willing to go non-organic if it means peanut butter cups on my cone.)
author: Kimberly N.

description: Sunday streets was an incentive for us to stroll around and pop into this place.  The fig ice-cream was wonderful - definitely could taste the figs.  What made me a fan was the saffron-ginger ice-cream - mmm, mmm, mmm.  Reminds me of Indian Kulfi.  They are open until 11:00 PM so we will probably be going here during the week.
author: Nick K.

description: I've been here 3 times, each time expecting something better.  Each time the ice cream is way too soft and the frozen yogurt is just horrible.  Icy and melty.  No wonder there's no line out the door.  This place has so much potential, since hipster ice cream seems to be the thing these days.
author: M C.

description: I have a tendency of comparing all ice cream shops to Mitchell's and nothing compares. Although I feel like I can blame my "eh" experience on the flavor I chose, am willing to give Xanath another try.
author: Melissa S.

description: nice , clean place , they have organic ice cream definetly a plus its really good, friendly people work there pumpkin frozen yogurt is off the hook.
author: NAEL K.

description: Finally made it to the latest ice cream addition to the hood. First off they get props for staying open late. Also I like the casual and not-at-all pretentious attitude - seems family run and everyone was pitching in and having fun and friendly. Also, the price is right - a single scoop is $1.99 and you can get two flavors. I went with Saffron Ginger and Fig - both delicious. The Saffron Ginger was subtle and not overdone, but still flavorful. The Fig tasted incredibly fresh and will be in my dish (I am not a cone kind of gal) every time I come back if they have it. Their window display is a little nutty (must be they also own or moved from the spot next to ATA across the street and up the block that just had bottles of vanilla, and beeswax and various things that had no logical connection in the window and was never open, so you couldn't go in and figure out what it was all about.) Seems like they import and maybe distribute the vanilla themselves, and they have a vanilla vine growing in the store which was cool. My bet is Xanath is here to stay.
author: Aimee G.

description: My two year old son's face and demeanor said it all.  Totally covered in delicious chocolate ice cream, running around in a state of pure bliss.  The toddler size bench out in front was perfect for us too.  And his more discriminating mama says this place is a thumbs up!  Had to try it since they use Strauss cream. The owner was super nice.  I asked him, after he came out with multiple napkins for my son, if this was his store.  He said "no, it's my wife's.  I just work here."
author: wendy m.

description: I really wanted to like and support this local place (one of the many new bi-rite competitors, which I am always happy to see, since, although bi-rite's ice cream is very good, I find it overated and annoyingly foodie-culty). Sadly, all the flavors i've tried at Xanath are way too sweet and unintersting, and the texture was too icy, not great. It looks like they sell Strauss, but the Strauss I know in the pints tastes better than this.
author: l x.

description: I had hopes, but there was unfortunately, nothing  exceptional about this newly opened ice cream shop on Valencia. Flavors were "standard", not very intense,  my choices, at least, had an icy texture, and portion/price was similar to Bi-rite and Humphery Slocombe. The staff was enthusiastic, but not very knowledgeable [ had never heard of a "half'nhalf"]. One young woman did say some of the flavors were made by the owner while others were Straus. Things could improve in every aspect, [this is literally its first week] but for now, it is clearly a "second tier" kind of place. Reminds me of Coco Loco on 22nd somehow... and of   decent "grocery store" ice creams
author: Jim F.
